issueDTO.title: Create a github bot that replies to pull requests that are not verified
issueDTO.description:
PROBLEM
We require ALL commits in a PR to be marked as 'verified' by github (green icon) in order to be able to merge code into main.
We have documentation that explains that.
However, we still get PR's that have some or all commits that are not verified.
As a maintainer, we need to comment on PR's manually to remind people and explain how to do it.

SOLUTION
We can create a github bot that recognises a pull request marked as ready for review that has unverified commits.
Immediately, it should respond something nice but informative e.g.

"Hi, this is PythonBot. I've noticed your pull request has commits that are not all marked as verified. For your pull request to be able to be merged, each commit must be verified.
Please read our documentation explaining signing and our general process to resolve this issue.
Reach out to us on discord or attend our community meetings for hands-on-help"

here we should point to:
docs/sdk_developers/signing.md
/README.md
docs/discord.md

IMPLEMENTATION
1. We need to first recognise when there is a new pull request to the python sdk repo

We could use a github action to extract the pull request number when it is created
name: Check PR Commits

on:
  pull_request:
    types: [opened, reopened, synchronize]  # triggers when a PR is created or updated

jobs:
  check_commits:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Print PR number
        run: |
          echo "This PR number is ${{ github.event.pull_request.number }}"
          echo "This PR title is ${{ github.event.pull_request.title }}"

(improve this please)

2. Once we know the PR number
Github has an API that we can extract data to check a pull request is 'verified'.
 
for example, for pull request 748: https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/pulls
the api is:
https://api.github.com/repos/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/pulls/748/commits
i.e
https://api.github.com/repos/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/pulls/{pull_request_number}/commits

notice there are 11 instances of "verified": true and there are 11 commits, therefore, all are verified.

We should:
- [ ] Extract the data from the pull request added
- [ ] Check if all commits are verified

So something like
          PR_NUMBER=${{ github.event.pull_request.number }}
          REPO="${{ github.repository }}"

          echo "🔎 Checking commits in PR #$PR_NUMBER..."

          UNVERIFIED=$(gh pr view $PR_NUMBER --repo $REPO --json commits --jq '.commits[].commit | select(.verification.verified == false) | .oid')

3. Once we know there are unverified commits, we send a frindly help bot reminder
?????? Some commits in this PR are **not verified**. Verified commits are required to merge.
..... (add the message)

Steps 1,2,3 I think can be created as one github workflow.

we could call it:
.github/workflows/bot-verified-commits.yml

SUCCESS CRITERIA
For this workflow to be accepted, it must actually work. Meaning:

A user submits a PR:
- [ ] If a commit is not verified in that PR, they should receive the bot message
- [ ] PR's with all commits verified should never receive a bot message

EXTRA REQUIREMENTS
Remember our process requires commits to be verified
use:
git commit -S -s -m "...."
additionally, you need a changelog entry

Please read README.md and CONTRIBUTING.md

Thank you


SAMPLE
here is an AI generated example which is unlikely to work and requires some thinking, but serves as an illustration
For example, notice that the packages that are being called are clearly outdated. For example, it is using checkout 4 but notice 5 is out. https://github.com/actions/checkout

So if you copy this it will not be accepted - please verify everything - thank you
I also don't know if a workflow is the correct approach - open to ideas

name: Verify PR Commits

on:
  pull_request:
    types: [opened, reopened, synchronize]  # Trigger for new or updated PRs

jobs:
  verify-commits:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout PR
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup GitHub CLI
        uses: cli/cli-action@v2

      - name: Check PR commits for verification
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        run: |
          PR_NUMBER=${{ github.event.pull_request.number }}
          REPO="${{ github.repository }}"

          echo "🔎 Checking commits in PR #$PR_NUMBER..."

          # Get unverified commit SHAs
          UNVERIFIED=$(gh pr view $PR_NUMBER --repo $REPO --json commits --jq '.commits[].commit | select(.verification.verified == false) | .oid')

          if [ -n "$UNVERIFIED" ]; then
            echo "??? Found unverified commits: $UNVERIFIED"
            # Post a comment on the PR
            gh pr comment $PR_NUMBER --repo $REPO --body "
?????? Some commits in this PR are **not verified**. Verified commits are required to merge.

Please see [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for instructions on signing commits.

If you are new to open source contributions, check our guide: [Good First Issues](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+org%3Ahiero-ledger+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22)
"
            exit 1  # Optional: fail workflow to block merge if branch protection requires
          else
            echo "??? All commits in this PR are verified"
          fi

@DinethShakya23 @anirudhsengar @Akshat8510

issueDTO.title: Update `tutor each` since it now takes closures rather than blocks
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

The tutorial is a bit outdated in places.  `tutor each` still discusses blocks, along with a link to `tutor block`.

### How to reproduce

`tutor each`

### Expected behavior

Probably need a section on closures and a separate one on blocks.  I plan on working on this, but if this is still open in the future, please go ahead and feel free to submit your own PR.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Configuration

| key                | value                                           |
| ------------------ | ----------------------------------------------- |
| version            | 0.93.0                                          |
| major              | 0                                               |
| minor              | 93                                              |
| patch              | 0                                               |
| branch             |                                                 |
| commit_hash        |                                                 |
| build_os           | linux-x86_64                                    |
| build_target       | x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu                        |
| rust_version       | rustc 1.77.2 (25ef9e3d8 2024-04-09)             |
| rust_channel       | stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu                 |
| cargo_version      | cargo 1.77.2 (e52e36006 2024-03-26)             |
| build_time         | 2024-05-04 12:29:25 -04:00                      |
| build_rust_channel | release                                         |
| allocator          | mimalloc                                        |
| features           | default, sqlite, system-clipboard, trash, which |
| installed_plugins  |                                                 |

### Additional context

_No response_
comments:
As of today (nu version 0.106.1), here is the output from `tutor each`:

```console
~> tutor each

The each command gives us a way of working with the individual elements
(sometimes called 'rows') of a list one at a time. It reads these in from
the pipeline and runs a block on each one. A block is a group of pipelines.

echo 1 2 3 | each { |it| $it + 10}

This example iterates over each element sent by echo, giving us three new
values that are the original value + 10. Here, the $it is a variable that
is the name given to the block's parameter by default.

You can learn more about blocks by running:

tutor blocks

You can also learn more about variables by running:

tutor variables
```
I can take this up

issueDTO.title: isAddress function causes memory leak on iOS 18+
issueDTO.description:
### Check existing issues

- [X] I checked there isn't [already an issue](https://github.com/wevm/viem/issues) for the bug I encountered.

### Viem Version

2.21.22

### Current Behavior

The isAddress function in the viem library appears to cause a memory leak on devices running iOS 18 or later. When repeatedly calling isAddress in an iOS environment (version 18+), memory consumption steadily increases and is not released, leading to degraded app performance and eventually crashing after prolonged usage.

### Expected Behavior

_No response_

### Steps To Reproduce

Use the isAddress function to validate addresses in a loop (having more items than 8k) or with frequent calls in an iOS app (version 18+). 

Platform: iOS 18+
Browser: Any
App: React-NextJs Web app

### Link to Minimal Reproducible Example

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

comments:
We currently have "Search ShortScience". We should add "Search Google Scholar". Maybe even make the search engine selectable (because a user tends to have a single favourite site; not multiple ones). First try to get this implemented: https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/8886
One really needs the comment at the linked pull request and come up with a proposal!
Aim: Get citation count (refs https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/168) and which papers are related.

issueDTO.title: Sqlalchemy 2 migration - Fix MyPy type errors in core Airflow
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow version

3.1.0

### If "Other Airflow 2/3 version" selected, which one?

_No response_

### What happened?

## Summary

This issue tracks the resolution of MyPy type errors found in the Airflow core codebase when SQLA 2 is used.
There are currently **525 errors across 100 files** that need to be addressed before being able to upgrade to SQLA2.
Also, this will improve type safety and code quality.

## How to generate the errors

- Apply changes from https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/56212 locally
- Run `breeze ci-image build --python 3.10 --upgrade-to-newer-dependencies`
- Run `prek --color always --verbose --hook-stage manual "mypy-airflow-core" --all-files` reveals numerous type errors throughout the codebase. These errors primarily involve:

  - Incompatible type assignments (datetime vs UtcDateTime)
  - Missing type annotations
  - Union type handling issues
  - SQLAlchemy ORM type mismatches
  - Return value type inconsistencies

## Current Status (Updated: 2025-11-07)

**Total errors found: 54 errors in 21 files (checked 1017 source files)**

## Error Breakdown by Directory

### airflow-core/src/airflow/api_fastapi/execution_api/ (2 errors in 2 files)
- [ ] `datamodels/hitl.py` (1 error)
- [ ] `routes/hitl.py` (1 error)

### airflow-core/src/airflow/models/ (24 errors in 8 files)
- [ ] `xcom.py` (4 errors)
- [ ] `dag_version.py` (1 error)
- [ ] `connection.py` (1 error)
- [ ] `dagbag.py` (2 errors)
- [ ] `taskmap.py` (3 errors)
- [ ] `variable.py` (4 errors)
- [ ] `dag.py` (3 errors)
- [ ] `dagrun.py` (5 errors)
- [ ] `serialized_dag.py` (6 errors)

### airflow-core/src/airflow/jobs/ (7 errors in 2 files)
- [ ] `job.py` (4 errors)
- [ ] `scheduler_job_runner.py` (3 errors)

### airflow-core/src/airflow/ti_deps/deps/ (6 errors in 1 file)
- [ ] `trigger_rule_dep.py` (6 errors)

### airflow-core/src/airflow/api/common/ (2 errors in 2 files)
- [ ] `delete_dag.py` (1 error)
- [ ] `mark_tasks.py` (1 error)

### airflow-core/src/airflow/api_fastapi/execution_api/routes/ (2 errors in 1 file)
- [ ] `task_instances.py` (2 errors)

### airflow-core/src/airflow/api_fastapi/common/db/ (1 error in 1 file)
- [ ] `dag_runs.py` (1 error)

### airflow-core/src/airflow/api_fastapi/core_api/ (1 error in 1 file)
- [ ] `security.py` (1 error)

### airflow-core/src/airflow/api_fastapi/core_api/routes/ui/ (2 errors in 2 files)
- [ ] `assets.py` (1 error)
- [ ] `dags.py` (1 error)

## How to Contribute

1. **Pick a file**: Choose an unchecked file from the list above
2. **Check the box**: Update this issue to mark the file as being worked on
3. **Run MyPy locally**: Follow the steps mentioned above to generate the errors. You can also run `prek mypy-airflow-core --directory <directory>` to run `mypy` in the directory you are working on
4. **Fix the errors**: Address the type errors in your chosen file
5. **Test your changes**: Ensure tests still pass
6. **Submit a PR**: Create a pull request with your fixes. Please do not include in your PR changes from https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/56212

## Guidelines

- Focus on one file or directory at a time
- Follow existing code patterns and conventions

---

Let's work together to improve Airflow's type safety! 🚀

**Note**: This issue was generated by running MyPy on the current codebase. The error counts may change as the codebase evolves.


### What you think should happen instead?

_No response_

### How to reproduce

- Apply changes from https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/56212 locally
- Run `breeze ci-image build --python 3.10 --upgrade-to-newer-dependencies`
- Run `prek --color always --verbose --hook-stage manual "mypy-airflow-core" --all-files` reveals numerous type errors throughout the codebase

### Operating System

Macos

### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers

_No response_

### Deployment

Other

### Deployment details

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

issueDTO.title: DateColumn (st.column_config.DateColumn) always defaults to mm/dd/yyyy when text editing.
issueDTO.description: ### Checklist - [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues. - [x] I added a very descriptive title to this issue. - [x] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue. ### Summary When editing a DateColumn cell in `st.data_editor`, the text input always defaults to mm/dd/yyyy format. Regardless of the `format` parameter specified in `st.column_config.DateColumn()`. The format parameter only affects the display mode, not the edit mode. ### Reproducible Code Example ```Python # this example is run on your own page - https://docs.streamlit.io/develop/api-reference/data/st.column_config/st.column_config.datecolumn from datetime import date import pandas as pd import streamlit as st data_df = pd.DataFrame( { "birthday": [ date(1980, 1, 1), date(1990, 5, 3), date(1974, 5, 19), date(2001, 8, 17), ] } ) st.data_editor( data_df, column_config={ "birthday": st.column_config.DateColumn( "Birthday", min_value=date(1900, 1, 1), max_value=date(2005, 1, 1), format="DD.MM.YYYY", step=1, ), }, hide_index=True, ) ``` ### Steps To Reproduce 1. Double-click any date cell in the data editor to enter edit mode 2. Observe how the text input changes ### Expected Behavior I'd expect to see the same format as defined in the input-field, not being forced to use mm/dd/yyyy. ### Current Behavior As shown in the pictures, the 19th of may is different when displayed as opposed edited. It ignores the format parameter. Locally I've also tested with different formats such as localized and iso8601 and the edited is always the same. The screenshots are taken on [your page](https://docs.streamlit.io/develop/api-reference/data/st.column_config/st.column_config.datecolumn) the 23rd of October. ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version. ### Debug info Streamlit version: 1.50.0 Python version: 3.13 (3.13.7 locally) Operating System: Windows 11 Browser: Mozilla ### Additional Information _No response_
comments:
**If this issue affects you, please react with a 👍 (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your feedback helps us prioritize which bugs to investigate and address first.

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-12850)

Hey @jofalck Thank you for the issue.

I indeed see the behavior you are seeing. I think as of now this is expected behavior, but I do agree this is less intuitive UX. I have just converted this to an Enhancement request that we can prioritize over time.

**To help Streamlit prioritize this feature, react with a 👍 (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your vote helps us identify which enhancements matter most to our users.

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-12850)

Hello @kmcgrady,
Thanks for the response.

I can see what you mean by calling this expected behavior, but I believe this conflicts with the purpose of having a *format* parameter. [The MDY standard is unusual pretty much everywhere except the US](https://iso.mit.edu/americanisms/date-format-in-the-united-states/), which makes this, for me as a non-American, unexpected behavior. From a European perspective (which applies to all of our users), this makes it difficult to set correct dates in a workflow. 

**Current impact:**

* Users see dates displayed as DD.MM.YYYY (e.g., 19.05.1974)
* When editing, they must input dates as MM/DD/YYYY (05/19/1974)
* This creates confusion and potential data entry errors

The edit mode should respect the format parameter, making the user experience consistent between display and input. Alternatively, defaulting to ISO 8601 would provide a universally recognized standard. I'd also be interested to understand the reasoning behind the current design choice of MDY.


I appreciate you considering this request for future prioritization, and thanks for your time.

Jo

issueDTO.title: [BUG] Rearranging the order of workspaces in Affinity by Canva causes a crash.
issueDTO.description: ### Does an issue for this already exist? - [x] I have searched the existing issues - [x] I have ensured my environment (operating system, app launcher, etc) is up to date ### Operating System and Version Linux Mint ### Launcher Lutris (Recommended) ### Launcher Installation Flatpak (Recommended) ### Other Install _No response_ ### Wine Version ElementalWarrior (Recommended) ### Affinity Version Canva 3.0.1.3808 ### Desktop Environment Cinnamon ### Description Affinity by Canva gives the ability to reorder your workspaces by dropping down the studio manager and simply dragging your workspace up or down the list, which reflects a change in the buttons on the top of the screen. If I attempt to do this, the program immediately hangs and then crashes consistently. This behavior occurs even if all workspaces are deactivated before any reordering occurs. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Open Affinity by Canva 2. Open the studio manager using the triple dot icon next to the workspace buttons. 3. Click and hold on any workspace, and drag it to a different position. ### Expected behaviour What should occur is a persistent changing of the order of the workspaces, and in the order of the buttons for said workspaces. ### Screenshots Before and after attempt to change order. Freezing and crash occurs immediately after. ### Logs ```shell N/A as far as I can tell. ``` ### Config _No response_
comments:
This is happening to me as well.  

Logs:
```
20:50:32.382 Exception thrown: 'System.NullReferenceException' in Serif.Windows.dll
20:50:32.383 Additional information: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
```

This appears to be happening at `Serif.Windows.DragDrop.DragDrop:631` for someone smarter than me who can look into this.
Thanks for the bug report.

summary.otherNotes: The issue is reproducible on Linux Mint with Lutris and Flatpak installations, with Affinity Version 3.0.1.3808 and Wine Version ElementalWarrior.

issueDTO.title: [Good First Issue]: Add import_model(tensor) to JS API
issueDTO.description:
### Context

OpenVINO works in Node.js environment!
We are looking for new contributors who can help with enabling C++ API methods 
in JavaScript side.

First of all read Node.js API [Contribution Guide](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/bindings/js/node/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### What needs to be done?

Recently there was added a new overload for Core.import_model()
See https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/pull/31327 and https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/pull/32651
In this task you will have to modify js api [Core.importModel()](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/133852e6e216967de383242422f6ff6cbf7bdf33/src/bindings/js/node/src/core_wrap.cpp#L314) and add appropriate test.

Check out existing [helper methods](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/master/src/bindings/js/node/include/helper.hpp) and an [example](https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/openvino/blob/300b9304f30391d14ca83d03a59b2ff5315956ac/src/bindings/js/node/src/core_wrap.cpp#L65) how to validate values from javascript.

issueDTO.title: 💡 Tutorial-like jupyter notebooks, e.g. How to add children of concepts as a collection?
issueDTO.description:
### Description

children of concepts should be automatically added to the collection
( or is this already implemented ?)
comments:
This is not implemented.

On what use case where you thinking? Should this be a way to flatten a hierarchy to a list and access the list as collection?

just to make collections more convenient: one only needs add the top-most concept (in stead of entering every single narrower  concept) in the list, the hierarchy can still be kept.
To avoid unintentional additions, we could introduce a syntax, like v4c-bc:0000001+ (addition of a plus at the end of the IRI) to indicate, please also include narrower terms as specified in the vocabulary.

We need not only Excel -> SKOS but also SKOS -> Excel which may get difficult for this convenience feature. Another detail to consider: skos:broader / skos:narrower may form circles that need to be handled. Both are not transitive by default. This will get too complex in my opinion.

Another way is to find the narrower concepts and add them to a collection via a separate script. With the help of a SPARQL query or by filtering the RDF triples the concepts missing in a collection can be found easily. An update of the collection turtle file can then be submitted as PR. A new Excel file with the extended collection will be automatically build by the pipeline.

Maybe we should add some jupyter notebooks that show how to do such things with rdflib.

I see your valid point, @dalito,
and I think a separate script (or jupyter notebook) will certainly help - it is a good idea, worth putting on the list of future features.

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE] Integrate GANQ as a Quantizer
issueDTO.description:
> ?????? If you want to work on this issue: please comment below and wait until a maintainer assigns this issue to you before opening a PR to avoid several contributions on the same issue. Thanks! 😊

## **??? What You???ll Do**

Right now, we have quantizers like Quanto, torchao or HQQ. It would be nice to integrate GANQ as a new quantizer. The final interface to apply the quantization method should look as follows:
```
model = ...

smash_config = SmashConfig()
smash_config["algo_group_1"] = "algo_1"
smash_config["algo_group_2"] = "algo_2"
smashed_model = smash(model=model, smash_config=smash_config)
```

## 🤖??Useful Resources

- [ ] Check the detailed [contributions guidelines](https://docs.pruna.ai/en/stable/docs_pruna/contributions/how_to_contribute.html#setup) with steps to integrate a new [algorithm](https://docs.pruna.ai/en/stable/docs_pruna/user_manual/customize_algorithm.html)
- [ ] Check the [paper](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2501.12956) and [github repo](https://github.com/Evans-Z/GANQ)
- [ ] Developp the integration.
- [ ] Test it and write the documentation.

## **??? Acceptance Criteria**

- **Tests & Docs:**??All existing and new unit tests pass, and the documentation is updated

And don???t forget to give us a ??????!

---

## **??? Questions?**

Feel free to jump into the [#contributing Discord channel](https://discord.com/invite/JFQmtFKCjd) if you hit any roadblocks. Can???t wait to see your contribution! 🚀

---

## Share on Socials

[![Share on X](https://img.shields.io/badge/Share_on_X-000?logo=x&logoColor=white)](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I%20just%20contributed%20to%20%40PrunaAI%20open%20source%20project!%20%F0%9F%9A%80%20Check%20out%20my%20PR%20%F0%9F%91%89%20%5BADD%20LINK%20TO%20PR%5D)
comments: hey @sharpenb i am interested in working on this issue, could I please be assigned to it?
@sunray4 hey, are you still working on this?
@sky-2002 Yup, I'm actively working on completing this issue
@sunray4 cool, feel free to ping if you would like to collaborate on this. I have recently been exploring quantization algorithms.

@sky-2002 tbh if you are also interested in this issue you are welcome to create your own implementation, I've been having a lot of trouble with this because there is very limited information on GANQ....
@sky-2002 I would assign you the issue as well. Please, let me know if you have points to discuss ;)

@sharpenb Yeah, well, I wanted to discuss one thing.

If you see the GANQ algorithm, the idea there is as follows:
For a weight matrix `W` of shape `m x n`, they create a codebook `T_i` with shape `1 x k` and a query matrix `S_i` of shape `k x n` (containing indices of values in codebook `T`, a one-hot like encoding) for each row of `W`. 

Note: `k` is 2^N, N is the bits per weight, I found it a little confusing, it feels more like a max unique numbers in a row of `W`. Please correct me here if I am mistaken.

During calibration, they optimise these Ts and Ss so that we can use `T_i x S_i` in place of `ith` row of `W`.

Now in the author's implementation, they update `W` like [this](https://github.com/PrunaAI/pruna/blob/a06cb52f85766e5a3e514119c35682ba3dd48b57/src/pruna/algorithms/quantization/backends/ganq/lut_quant.py#L183), during quantization. So at the end, we still get a `W` (full precision, just that each row now is made up of `k` unique values). It would still use the same amount of memory, so I think the author's code just shows the algorithm, the actual look-up table based quantization in inference, we have to build. Otherwise we won't be able to see the advantage of this, since we end up storing `m x n` values for a matrix, whereas with `T` and `S`, we get `m x k` + `N x m  x n` (since we only store index of which codebook entry to pick, not the whole one hot matrix), this ends up consuming lesser memory.

So I wanted to discuss how should we store these `T_i` and `S_i` for each weight matrix so that they can be used at inference time to calculate `W_q` (the quantized weights)

Again, feel free to correct me if I have misunderstood something.

Sure, here are some elements:
- k is indeed 2^N where N is the bits per weight. It could be that a row in the quantized W does not use all the possible encodings that the N bits offer, hence max unique numbers in a row could be smaller than k. If you are talking about the original W, the number of unique values in a row of W is not related to the number k which is defined from the number of bits that the user wants to use for quantization.
- Regarding the author code, my suggestion would be to run the author and measure the peak memory of the model before after quantization to check whether their code can be used. Their paper reports memory and latency reduction and say that it uses LUT-based inference kernels from others, thus leveraging the T and S data format to optimize memory and speed. Normally all values in S should indeed be stored in N bits while values in T should be stored in high precision.

@sharpenb Right, I saw that the paper mentions some other works which implement LUT based kernels, for example [squeezellm](https://github.com/SqueezeAILab/SqueezeLLM/blob/main/squeezellm/quant.py).

Also, I checked peak memory during inference using the author's code, it is exactly same as original model, because in author's code, they replace `W` with `T x S`, however the values now come from `T` and `S`, verified using this:

```python

def verify_unique_entries_in_row(layer, row_idx=0):
    Wq = layer.self_attn.q_proj.weight.data
    unique_entries = torch.unique(Wq[row_idx])
    print(f"Number of unique entries in row {row_idx}: {unique_entries.numel()}")

verify_unique_entries_in_row(model_q.model.layers[1], row_idx=1)
verify_unique_entries_in_row(model.model.layers[1], row_idx=1)


# Number of unique entries in row 1: 16  (4 bit)
# Number of unique entries in row 1: 471
```

At inference time, we need to replace normal linear layers in the model with `QuantLinearLUT` as in `squeezellm`.

How should this be integrated into pruna code? I need some suggestions(on code organization and best practices for integrating such things) here. You can take a look at my PR above to see how I have used author's code currently.

One option I think is to create a [huggingface kernel](https://huggingface.co/docs/kernels/index) and pushed to kernel hub and use from there, this helps pruna codebase remain clean. Because if we just use the kernel from the `squeezellm` repo, we would be placing `cuda` and `cpp` files in pruna, and this would lead to folks not being able to use some other LUT kernel. 

Let me know what you think?

issueDTO.title: [BUG]: Search bar moves up and down when typing
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

Search bar moves up and down when typing on the community library page. It should stay in one place, at the top.

### URL of the page where the issue is observed.

https://www.oppiatestserver.org/community-library

### Steps To Reproduce

**Precondition:** user is logged in
Steps:
1. Navigate to https://www.oppiatestserver.org/community-library
2. Start typing "search"
3. Observe
4. Remove what you typed
5. Type "I am searching"
6. Observe

### Expected Behavior

The search bar stays in one place

### Screenshots/Videos


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fccb092e-268f-40cf-bd56-df88e278b791



### What device are you using?

Desktop

### Operating System

MacOS

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### Browser version

Chrome 126.0.6478.57, Firefox 127.0

### Additional context

_No response_

### Tips for developers

Before addressing the bug, please identify which PR caused the issue (you can follow the steps [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/How-to-find-the-commit-which-introduced-a-bug)). If you identify the PR, comment on the issue with a link to it. If not, mention the commit hash of the oldest commit you saw the bug on (and the month and year it was made in).

Then, please leave a comment with details of the approach that you plan to take to fix the issue (see [example](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/19157#issuecomment-1858788463)).

**Note:** If this is your first Oppia issue, please make sure to follow our guidelines for [choosing an issue](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#choosing-a-good-first-issue) and [setting things up](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#setting-things-up). You will also need to show a demo of the fix working correctly on your local machine. Thanks!
comments:
@HardikGoyal2003 
Proposed Solution:-

Objective: Ensure the search bar remains fixed and centered at the top of the page, regardless of user input.

Solution Approach:-

1. CSS Adjustments:-
Update CSS Rules: Modify the CSS rules to ensure that the search bar maintains a fixed position at the top of the page and remains centered. This will prevent it from moving up and down while typing or deleting text.

2. Files to be Updated:-
oppia-search-bar.component.css: Implement the necessary CSS changes to achieve stable positioning of the search bar.

Specific Changes to be Made:-
1. Adjust the position, top, and left properties to ensure the search bar stays fixed at the top of the page.
2. Ensure the margin, padding, and text-align properties are set to keep the search bar centered horizontally.
3. Verify and adjust the width and max-width to ensure the search bar fits well on various screen sizes.

Testing:-

Verify that the search bar remains fixed in place when typing and deleting text.
Test across different screen sizes to ensure consistent behavior and that the search bar is always centered.

Request: Please assign this issue to me so I can proceed with the implementation and resolve the problem.

Thank you!

Hi @KartikSuryavanshi, sorry for the confusion. This issue already has a reviewed PR linked to it, but the reviewer forgot to assign it. You can find available issues at https://github.com/oppia/oppia/labels/good%20first%20issue.

I have assigned this to myself since I can't assign it to [NitinPSingh](https://github.com/NitinPSingh) right now. Once this [PR](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/20816) is merged, I will unassign it and close this issue. Thanks!
Hey, I want to work on this issue can you assign me this issue?
Hey @TejasSaraf  This issue has already been assigned, you can choose issues from [good first issue](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/labels/good%20first%20issue) . Thanks!!
Note: The previous assignee was not responding, so we have unassigned them. This issue is again open for contributions.

heyy @seanlip, I think I fixed  the bug. Please assign the bug to me ! here is the solution: 
so the problem is in library-page.component.css. In fact, the problem is in this part of the code : 
![image_2024-10-13_172449642](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ef426c7-b9c3-4e52-9a14-0373dc4724b2)
We should juste delete the part of :   
min-height: 100vh;
and the problem will be fixed this way.
And here is the video that proves that the bug will be fixed thsi way : 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b9c13adb-750f-459d-9654-bab56df073c3

Thanks @mohamedchouaib, that seems reasonable, but I noticed it's a different solution from https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/20816. Could you PTAL at that PR, and advise on which of the two solutions is the best one to go with?

Also in your proof video, please try pressing enter on the search once (to go to the /search page) and verify the behaviour there as well.

Thanks!

@seanlip 
The initial approach tackles the problem through the manipulation of margins (for example, by utilizing Bootstrap), but heavily depends on the use of the utility classes behavior which might fail in some screen sizes. Conversely, the second approach neglecting min-height: 100vh helps the page adapt to any screen or content automatically.

And here is the video : 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7dd9859e-a17e-48d7-97e1-7a47dd2f4e28

@seanlip Thanks so much for your feedback! I wanted to share my thoughts on the min-height property and why I believe it should be removed from our design.

While min-height can be helpful for scrolling, in our situation, it tends to cause awkward empty spaces at the bottom of the page when there's not much content. This can negatively impact the user experience, making the page feel unbalanced.

If we remove the min-height, we can keep the content aligned at the top, which allows for a more natural scrolling experience. This way, users can easily view all the content without being distracted by those empty spaces.

I also feel that using mx-auto might complicate things without solving the real issues of alignment and scrolling. It???s best to keep our layout straightforward.

As for testing my code locally, I???m currently facing a challenge since I don???t have access to a database or any sample cards. This makes it tough to demonstrate the fix effectively. If we could create a temporary mock dataset, that would really help me showcase the solution more accurately.

Hi @seanlip, I think this will solve the problem. Like you mentioned adding mx-auto similar to #20816 seems to solve the problem (see video below):

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eb83b490-2bb0-421e-bd05-214c4c4178b8

As for the min-height discussed, it cannot simply be removed, as that will create empty white space at the bottom of the page. The min-height can however be reduced by 400px (the height of the navbar-container and classroom-card-wrapper combined) to remove the extra blank space left below a search with few results (see video below):

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/97407eda-a81a-430e-a38f-dfcd484f7fa6

If this looks okay, can I be assigned to the issue? If so, should I implement both changes or just the mx-auto change?

@TheSolarz Yes, this seems good, thanks! Please implement both changes (to be clear, if one result is shown, then the whole bottom part of the screen background should be blue -- there shouldn't be a grey at the bottom).

Please also make sure your changes generalize properly to all viewport heights/widths (e.g. tall/short viewports), and demonstrate that in your "proof" video for the PR. Thanks!

ERROR: ArgumentError: cannot parse "lumn" as Float64
Stacktrace:
 [1] _parse_failure(T::Type, s::String, startpos::Int64, endpos::Int64) (repeats 2 times)
   @ Base ./parse.jl:373
 [2] #tryparse_internal#403
   @ ./parse.jl:369 [inlined]
 [3] tryparse_internal
   @ ./parse.jl:367 [inlined]
 [4] #parse#404
   @ ./parse.jl:379 [inlined]
 [5] parse
   @ ./parse.jl:379 [inlined]
 [6] read_columns_line!(qps::QPSReader.QPSData, card::QPSReader.MPSCard{QPSReader.FixedMPS}; integer_section::Bool)
   @ QPSReader ~/.julia/packages/QPSReader/panNr/src/readqps.jl:487
 [7] readqps(qps::GZip.GZipStream; mpsformat::Symbol)
   @ QPSReader ~/.julia/packages/QPSReader/panNr/src/readqps.jl:856
 [8] top-level scope
   @ REPL[5]:1
```

The problematic line in the file is likely:
```
    C0063540  LB_full              0   $ empty column
```

I had never seen "$" in an MPS file before, but apparently it's valid comment in fixed format. [IBM docs](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/icos/20.1.0?topic=standard-records-in-mps-format) say:
> If the first character in Field 3 or 5 is a dollar sign ($), the remaining characters in the record are treated as a comment. Another method for inserting comments is to place an asterisk (*) in column 1. Everything on such a line is treated as a comment.
comments: Thanks, we???ll have to fix that. I???ve seen the `$` sign in SIF files, which extend the MPS format (e.g., https://bitbucket.org/optrove/sif/src/5c8160a862979517e3dd28ae39d71b865a56e90c/10FOLDTR.SIF#lines-25).

For pointers, here are the 2 lines that would need changing, for handling lines that start with a `$`
https://github.com/JuliaSmoothOptimizers/QPSReader.jl/blob/ed54ce746fd707eca53ccb4c13d33c665daf4884/src/readqps.jl#L204
https://github.com/JuliaSmoothOptimizers/QPSReader.jl/blob/ed54ce746fd707eca53ccb4c13d33c665daf4884/src/readqps.jl#L316

It just needs adding `|| ln[1] == '$'`.


For in-line comments we would have to explicitly check the first character of fields 3 & 5 (following the IBM docs) and discard everything after that.

Jus popping by to say that I'm facing this problem too (while working on cuPDLP) but the error has changed:

```julia
julia> using QPSReader

julia> readqps("neos-5044663-wairoa.mps")
[ Info: Using 'neos-5044663-wairoa' as NAME (l. 8)
[ Info: Using 'R0000000' as objective (l. 10)
ERROR: ArgumentError: cannot parse "empty" as Float64
```

@amontoison does your PR fix it?
I need to try again. I will have a look later today.

repository.name: QPSReader.jl

summary.main: The issue is about parsing the MPS file and reading the qps data, specifically handling lines that start with a dollar sign ($).
summary.validationOrRequirement: The MPS file format requires that the first character of fields 3 & 5 be checked for inline comments, which are ignored. The PR by @amontoison does not fully address this requirement.
summary.attemptedFixes: The PR by @amontoison adds a check to ignore lines that start with a dollar sign, but the error has changed to an ArgumentError: cannot parse "empty" as Float64.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to parsing the MPS file, specifically the line C0063540  LB_full              0   $ empty column, which contains a dollar sign ($). The PR by @amontoison fixes the issue by adding a check to ignore lines that start with a dollar sign.

issueDTO.title: alternator: duplicated validation for LWT based write operations
issueDTO.description:
Constructors of classes derived from `public rmw_operation` are executed twice when we bounce LWT operation to a proper shard. This is not very expensive operation but it's also not free as it calls rjson::find multiple times and in some cases also expression parsing.

To locate all cases search for: `_stats.shard_bounce_for_lwt` metric.
comments:
This was not a simple oversight, but rather a genuine difficulty that I solved "the easy way" but perhaps should indeed be solved the more efficient way, instead:

The `proxy.cas()` (the LWT code) demands that it be called in a specific shard which "owns" the partition being written. Therefore we need to **first** parse the request, and only then jump to the right shard and call `cas()` on that shard. The problem is that passing the already-parsed-request object to a different shard is not easy - e.g., the parsed request may include references to schemas, to shared pointers, and other objects which may not be used across shard boundary. Because I was too lazy to figure out how to safely used a parsed request across across shards, I took the easy way out: I pass the query as a string to the right shard, and it will need to parse it again.
Hi i am a new contributor and would like to work on this issue if possible? Thanks for your time.

> Hi i am a new contributor and would like to work on this issue if possible? Thanks for your time.

Please sign our contributor license agreement (CLA), and send a PR!

summary.main: Constructors of classes derived from `public rmw_operation` are executed twice when we bounce LWT operation to a proper shard.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The `proxy.cas()` (the LWT code) demands that it be called in a specific shard which "owns" the partition being written.
summary.attemptedFixes: The easy way out: passing the query as a string to the right shard, and it will need to parse it again.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is not a simple oversight, but rather a genuine difficulty that was solved the easy way. The problem is that passing the already-parsed-request object to a different shard is not easy.

issueDTO.title: Enable Even More PyDocStyle Checks
issueDTO.description:
### Description

Followup to https://github.com/apache/airflow/issues/10742

We use Ruff to enforce docsting style
https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/23b8e839a35e84d57c5cf38b0b21171ac3bd1ecc/pyproject.toml#L47-L74

We follow pep257 style (http://www.pydocstyle.org/en/stable/error_codes.html) for checks.

Currently, we ignore the following rules and should work towards enabling them:


**Missing Docstrings**
--

- [x] D100 | Missing docstring in public module https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/40741
- [x] D102 | Missing docstring in public method https://lists.apache.org/thread/lcvocwxnrrzq9ofrg4b4hj0yvpzbnygf
- [x] D103| Missing docstring in public function https://lists.apache.org/thread/lcvocwxnrrzq9ofrg4b4hj0yvpzbnygf
- [x] D104 | Missing docstring in public package https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/40741
- [x] D107 | Missing docstring in `__init__` https://lists.apache.org/thread/lcvocwxnrrzq9ofrg4b4hj0yvpzbnygf
- [x] D214 | Consistent multi-line docstring indentation
- [x] D215 | Enforce number of underscores if you use underlines in a multi-line docstring
- [x] PT004 | Fixture does not return anything, add leading underscore
- [ ] PT006 | @pytest.mark.parametrize names should be a tuple
- [x] PT007 | @pytest.mark.parametrize values should be a tuple
- [ ] PT011 | pytest.raises() is too broad, set the match parameter
- [x] TCH003 | stdlib imports which are only used for typechecking go in to TYPE_CHECKING block


It would be good if we can enable them one by one -- separate PRs are ok

**Rough process to fix these**
--

0.  Set up your dev environment [[docs](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/contributing-docs/README.rst)]
0.5. Go to your `airflow` directory and run `ruff check`.  Write down the number of failures.  Mine currently says 8.  This step is just to make sure it's working and give you a baseline.

1. Open `/airflow/pyproject.toml`
2. In the `ignore` list (currently starting on [line 301](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/pyproject.toml#L301)) comment out the rule you intend to work on
3. In a terminal, go to the `airflow` directory and run `ruff check` again.  It should now fail with WAY more errors.  Mine currently says 863.  If the number didn't go way up, something is wrong with your setup.
4. Have a quick scroll through that list, paying attention to which ones failed because of the rule you just enabled.
5. Come up with a rough plan to break that down into bites.  Maybe pick one directory that has a bunch of failures and start fixing there.
6. After you have a handful of fixes done: remove your comment (so it is ignored again) and submit a PR with that chunk of changes (see the Contributing docs in step 0)

PLEASE submit these in many small PRs.  If you do it all at once it will turn into a 3000-line PR and nobody will review it.  Eventually, on the last chunk you'll just remove that line from the ignore list entirely when there are no more violations to fix. 


Let me know if you need any help, or ask in the Slack server.
comments: I included D107 in the list because it was part of the original plan in https://github.com/apache/airflow/issues/10742, but I'd like to argue for dropping it.    I don't feel that a docstring in every `__init__` method is helpful at all.  We're going to just copy/paste something like "Construct the {Class Name} object." a billion times.
Hi Ferruzzi, Can I take up this issue?
Feel Free.

Please do!    You don't even need to take the whole thing.  In fact, this is much easier to do in small chunks.   Fix all the D100 changes in one area, submit the PR, fix another area, submit that pr, etc. then move on to D102 and start over, etc.   Small PRs are easier for folks to review and more likely to get merged quickly.  

This could (should?) easily be a team project for a bunch of people, just take bites out of it when and where you can.

Feel free to hit me up on Slack if you need a hand getting started.
You know what, I'm just going to make the call and drop D107 off this list.  If someone wants to do it, they are welcome to but I won't consider it a requirement to close this project.  :+1:

After some discussion [on the mailing list ](https://lists.apache.org/thread/lcvocwxnrrzq9ofrg4b4hj0yvpzbnygf) it looks like D102 and D103 are minimal benefit, but we do have a few others we'd like to enable and a couple that are still being discussed.   I'll update the original description with details.

I can make a PR for:
- D214 | Consistent multi-line docstring indentation

> I can make a PR for:
> 
> * D214 | Consistent multi-line docstring indentation

Update: I believe `D214` can be marked as complete. I ran `ruff check` with the `D214` commented out in the ignore list and there were no additional errors. Verified that my environment was working by manually changing the spacing of a couple of function header docstrings to trigger errors.

> > I can make a PR for:
> > 
> > * D214 | Consistent multi-line docstring indentation
> 
> Update: I believe `D214` can be marked as complete. I ran `ruff check` with the `D214` commented out in the ignore list and there were no additional errors. Verified that my environment was working by manually changing the spacing of a couple of function header docstrings to trigger errors.

Same with `D215`
Looks like you are correct, I'll check them off on the list here.  Can you submit a PR with those two removed from the ignore list so they are enabled, please?

> Looks like you are correct, I'll check them off on the list here. Can you submit a PR with those two removed from the ignore list so they are enabled, please?

Done! @ferruzzi 
https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/42802/

@ferruzzi I saw PT006 have many file changes. Does it PR possible be reviewed?
I want to confirm which rules are still left to be changed.
It's a huge one with no context in the description and I wasn't tagged... not a surprise nobody reviewed it.  I'll try to work through it.
I can work for it, but I need to separate to many PR. Only I need to make sure which rules we need. PT007 is comment no need. I worried that PR close after I modified.

I saw that and I disagree with their opinion on that one.  Maybe take a stab at PT011, tag me in the PRs, and try to break them into bite-sized chunks.  We need two approvals for each PR and it's hard to get two people to look at a PR that is going to take hours to review.

Or maybe you could reach out to @rawwar and see if they mind if you break their PR for 006 into many small ones.  If you do that, make sure to add them in the commit message as co-author so they get credit for their work too.
All PT011 rule error is modify done. How about PT006 and PT007?
The community in general vetoed 007 (I just marked it as done, sorry about that), but If you want to take 006 it sounded like that would be appreciated!

Current airflow project contains 1563 PT006 errors in 496 files. I'll do the same way as what we do in PT011 and add @rawwar  "Co-authored-by: Kalyan R <kalyan.ben10@live.com>" in the commit. I think we will have total 100 PRs if we put about 5 file change in a PR.

issueDTO.description:
### DO NOT REMOVE OR SKIP THE ISSUE TEMPLATE

- [X] I understand that I will be **blocked** if I *intentionally* remove or skip any mandatory\* field

### Checklist

- [X] I'm reporting a bug unrelated to a specific site
- [X] I've verified that I'm running yt-dlp version **2023.06.22** ([update instructions](https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp#update)) or later (specify commit)
- [X] I've checked that all provided URLs are playable in a browser with the same IP and same login details
- [X] I've checked that all URLs and arguments with special characters are [properly quoted or escaped](https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp/wiki/FAQ#video-url-contains-an-ampersand--and-im-getting-some-strange-output-1-2839-or-v-is-not-recognized-as-an-internal-or-external-command)
- [X] I've searched [known issues](https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp/issues/3766) and the [bugtracker](https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp/issues?q=) for similar issues **including closed ones**. DO NOT post duplicates
- [X] I've read the [guidelines for opening an issue](https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#opening-an-issue)

### Provide a description that is worded well enough to be understood

When downloading YouTube videos, I need to give cookies for it to be able to download age-gated content. This has worked in the past when using "cookies.txt" files, but I recently tried using the "--cookies-from-browser safari" tag. This doesn't work, however. It gives an error about `PermissionError: [Errno 1] Operation not permitted: '/Users/thecoderpro/Library/Containers/com.apple.Safari/Data/Library/Cookies/Cookies.binarycookies'`.

comments: Does it work if you close Safari completely and run yt-dlp with `--cookies-from-browser safari`?

I cant check right now but I will check in an hour or soSent from my iPhoneOn 23 Jun 2023, at 12:57, bashonly ***@***.***> wrote:???
Does it work if you close Safari completely and run yt-dlp with --cookies-from-browser safari?

???Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID: ***@***.***>
no, it didn't fix the problem, the exact same error appeared. @bashonly

What happens if you try to manually open this file?

> /Users/thecoderpro/Library/Containers/com.apple.Safari/Data/Library/Cookies/Cookies.binarycookies
Also, you may want to try running yt-dlp with sudo

@pukkandan  I can find the file in Finder, and access it using Hex Fiend without problems. Running yt-dlp as Sudo doesn't fix the problem, it gives the same error again. Is there a way to point yt-dlp to a custom `.binarycookies` file and just copy the cookies over to another folder?

> Is there a way to point yt-dlp to a custom `.binarycookies` file and just copy the cookies over to another folder?

`--cookies-from-browser safari:path`

By the way, you don't need cookies for most age-gated videos (although they may download slightly higher quality)

> Also, you may want to try running yt-dlp with sudo

I suspect that OP is using brew. Is it possible that brew sandboxes yt-dlp?
@gamer191 yes, I am using `brew install yt-dlp`
@TheCoderProYT do you have another browser installed (firefox, chrome) that you could test to see if it is also impacted?

Have received 2 other reports of this from the discord server now.

 - `yt-dlp_macos` binary is affected too, not just brew installations
 - `sudo` doesn't help
 - both `yt-dlp_macos` and brew install could load cookies from chrome
You can get around this by going into System Preferences > Security & Privacy and giving Full Disk Access to Terminal.
In that case, all we can do is improve the error message

> You can get around this by going into System Preferences > Security & Privacy and giving Full Disk Access to Terminal.

Is this possible on windows 10? Opening the System Preferences, the Security option gives no option for disck access

> Is this possible on windows 10? Opening the System Preferences, the Security option gives no option for disck access

This is a macOS-specific workaround to a macOS-specific problem. If you are on Windows, this issue is not relevant to you. If you are trying to use `--cookies-from-browser` with a Chromium-based browser on Windows, you might want to take a look at #10927 instead.
I Updated The Error Message
How about some alternative (and not so dangerous) ways to get the cookies? Some manual interaction with the browser, snippet to paste in the console or copy line from storage in devtools.

issueDTO.title: [Improvement] Work towards Maven 4 Compatibility

issueDTO.title: Configuration option for changed ssl_cert_reqs default behaviour in redis-py
issueDTO.description:
Hello,

we're experiencing connection issues with Amazon AWS ElastiCache Redis instances over TLS (rediss://...). After raising an issue with redis-py, this seems to be related to a changed default setting/behaviour in redis-py 3.x for the argument "ssl_cert_reqs". Related ticket is: https://github.com/andymccurdy/redis-py/issues/1080
It seems this cannot be configured in django-redis? Can you please add a configuration option?
comments: @michael-k just to confirm, is that working for you connecting to Elasticache now?  Thanks for the insight!

@jplock Yes it is.  We're running our code inside debian-stretch docker images.  You might need to adjust the filename (and maybe the path?) if you run your code in a different environment.

`/etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt` worked here: https://github.com/andymccurdy/redis-py/issues/1080#issuecomment-445058335

On AWS Lambda these files exist, but I don't know which one to pick??: `/etc/ssl/certs/ca-bundle.trust.crt`, `/etc/ssl/certs/ca-bundle.crt`

?? Update: see https://serverfault.com/questions/620003/difference-between-ca-bundle-crt-and-ca-bundle-trust-crt; we now use `/etc/ssl/certs/ca-bundle.trust.crt` and it works :)

For anyone else finding this and getting blocked by `unexpected keyword argument 'ssl_ca_certs'`, you need to change your `LOCATION` parameter in a very subtle way, from

```
'LOCATION': 'redis://{}:6379/0'.format(REDIS_ADDRESS),
'LOCATION': 'rediss://{}:6379/0'.format(REDIS_ADDRESS),
```

The extra S is for SSL!

Hi Everyone,

I'm trying to connect AWS elasticache(cluster mode) with TLS enabled, the library versions and django cache settings as below

```
====Dependencies======
redis==3.0.0
redis-py-cluster==2.0.0
django-redis==4.11.0

======settings=======
CACHES = {
    'default': {
        'BACKEND': 'django_redis.cache.RedisCache',
        'LOCATION': "redis://xxxxxxx.mc-redis-cache-v2.zzzzz.usw2.cache.amazonaws.com:6379/0",
        'OPTIONS': {
            'PASSWORD': '<password>',
            'REDIS_CLIENT_CLASS': 'rediscluster.RedisCluster',
            'CONNECTION_POOL_CLASS': 'rediscluster.connection.ClusterConnectionPool',
            'CONNECTION_POOL_KWARGS': {
                'skip_full_coverage_check': True,
                "ssl_cert_reqs": False,
                "ssl": True
            }
        }
    }
}
```
It doesn't seem to be a problem with client-class since I'm able to access 
```
from rediscluster import RedisCluster
startup_nodes = [{"host": "redis://xxxxxxx.mc-redis-cache-v2.zzzzz.usw2.cache.amazonaws.com", "port": "6379"}]

rc = RedisCluster(startup_nodes=startup_nodes, ssl=True, ssl_cert_reqs=False, decode_responses=True, skip_full_coverage_check=True, password='<password>')

rc.set("foo", "bar")
rc.get('foo')
'bar'
```

but I'm seeing this error when django service is trying to access the cache, is there any configuration detail that I might be missing?
```
File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django_redis/cache.py", line 32, in _decorator
    return method(self, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django_redis/cache.py", line 81, in get
    client=client)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django_redis/client/default.py", line 194, in get
    client = self.get_client(write=False)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django_redis/client/default.py", line 90, in get_client
    self._clients[index] = self.connect(index)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django_redis/client/default.py", line 103, in connect
    return self.connection_factory.connect(self._server[index])
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django_redis/pool.py", line 64, in connect
    connection = self.get_connection(params)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django_redis/pool.py", line 75, in get_connection
    pool = self.get_or_create_connection_pool(params)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django_redis/pool.py", line 94, in get_or_create_connection_pool
    self._pools[key] = self.get_connection_pool(params)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django_redis/pool.py", line 107, in get_connection_pool
    pool = self.pool_cls.from_url(**cp_params)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/redis/connection.py", line 916, in from_url
    return cls(**kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rediscluster/connection.py", line 146, in __init__
    self.nodes.initialize()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rediscluster/nodemanager.py", line 172, in initialize
    raise RedisClusterException("ERROR sending 'cluster slots' command to redis server: {0}".format(node))
rediscluster.exceptions.RedisClusterException: ERROR sending 'cluster slots' command to redis server: {'host': 'xxxxxxx.mc-redis-cache-v2.zzzzz.usw2.cache.amazonaws.com', 'port': '6379'}
```

I also tried passing `"ssl_ca_certs": "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt"` to `CONNECTION_POOL_KWARGS` and setting the location scheme to `rediss` still no luck

I'm having the same issue as @kashypAkash. In addition, I'm getting this error here:
```
app_1  | Traceback (most recent call last):
app_1  |   File "/env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/rediscluster/nodemanager.py", line 162, in initialize
app_1  |     cluster_slots = r.execute_command("cluster", "slots")
app_1  |   File "/env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/redis/client.py", line 755, in execute_command
app_1  |     return self.parse_response(connection, command_name, **options)
app_1  |   File "/env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/redis/client.py", line 768, in parse_response
app_1  |     response = connection.read_response()
app_1  |   File "/env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/redis/connection.py", line 638, in read_response
app_1  |     raise response
app_1  | redis.exceptions.ResponseError: NOAUTH Authentication required.
```

Is anyone of you interested in clearing out this doubt in the docs?

Maybe in a `FAQ` section

summary.otherNotes: The issue is about configuration option for changed ssl_cert_reqs default behaviour in redis-py. The problem is that redis-py 3.x changed the default setting/behaviour for the argument 'ssl_cert_reqs' and it cannot be configured in django-redis. The user is trying to connect AWS elasticache(cluster mode) with TLS enabled, but getting an error saying 'unexpected keyword argument 'ssl_ca_certs''.

issueDTO.title: Optimization for \K at root level
issueDTO.description:
We recently introduced an optimization step which runs after parsing but before analyzing the regex pattern: https://github.com/fancy-regex/fancy-regex/pull/171

It works by rewriting an expression with a trailing positive lookahead into the same expression semantically, by using an explicit capture group 0 and removing the lookahead itself, just keeping the contents.

We can do something similar for `\K` at root level i.e. convert `\w+:\s*"\K[^"]*` into  `\w+:\s*"([^"]*)`. If the `tree.expr` is a `Concat`, iterate through the children to see if one of those children is a `KeepOut`. If it is, put the remainder of the children (i.e. after/following the `\K`) into a capture group which will be group 0, and replace the `KeepOut` `Expr` with that capture group. Then, it will automatically work such that if the rest of the expression is easy, it will delegate the whole thing to the regex crate without going through the VM.

Bonus points if it will interact with trailing lookaheads, to apply both optimizations together with only creating one new capture group...
i.e. turn `\w+:\s*"\K[^"]*(?=")` into  `\w+:\s*"([^"]*)"`. Otherwise, we may be able to only one of those optimizations at a time, because we can't have 2 explicit capture group 0s... (or can we? perhaps try it...)

The same criteria applies as for the trailing lookahead rewriting - we can only do it if the entire expression isn't recursive otherwise it will change the semantics

repository.description: Rust library for regular expressions using "fancy" features like look-around and backreferences
repository.name: fancy-regex

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to optimize the regex pattern by rewriting it to use a capture group instead of a lookahead, and to apply this optimization to the root level of the pattern.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires that the optimization be applied to the root level of the pattern, and that it does not change the semantics of the expression if it is recursive.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue mentions a few ideas for attempted fixes, including rewriting the pattern to use a capture group, and creating a new capture group to hold the remainder of the children in a Concat expression.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about optimizing the regex pattern by rewriting it to use a capture group instead of a lookahead, and also to apply the optimization to the root level of the pattern. It mentions a pull request for a similar optimization step.

issueDTO.description:
see #1390 for details.

https://github.com/sbi-dev/sbi/blob/4c1ffa256f530ae09a330078a188e1dfa0b5603e/tests/mcmc_test.py#L188-L196

comments:
Hi @janfb @gmoss13,

I hope you're doing well!

I???d like to take on this issue. From what I understand, the solution would involve checking if a new version of **PyMC** has been released that fixes the `TypeError` issue introduced in `version 5.20.1`. If there is a new release, I would then remove the `xfail` marks from the tests in `sbi/tests/mcmc_test.py` and `sbi/tests/posterior_sampler_test.py`.

Could you please assign this issue to me?

Thank You !

Hi @Muhammad-Rebaal 

thanks for offering to take on this issue. Yes, your plan looks good. Maybe this has been raised as an issue in `pymc` already. 

If not, we should find out what exactly causes the error. Maybe there is a workaround for use until `pymc` has a fix. Maybe this problem is actually caused on our end and we can fix it. If not, we should create an issue in `pymc`. 

Let me know if you have any questions!
Hi @janfb, since Muhammad didn???t raise a PR, I will go ahead and try to resolve this issue???if that???s okay with you. He was assigned to it back in March, and now it???s already November.
yeah, sounds good! Please check our contribution guide for how to get started contributing. Let me know if you need any input. Thanks! 🙏

@janfb The new release of pymc has not been made that solves this issue and there are no any mentioned issue that points to this,  when i searched in issue tracker of pymc . I think the workaround is to constrain the pymc version to 5.20.0 not sure if there are other options for it . Can you please suggest me what shall i do next ?

Great to get this started! 

A couple of questions: 
- Where you able to reproduce the issue with the current `sbi` release, `0.25`, by running the test without the `fail` mark? 
- Does the error message still occur if you manually install the most recent pymc?

Yes, the issue still persists with the current sbi release (v0.25). I ran the test without the @pytest.mark.xfail decorator and reproduced the error. Additionally, manually installing the latest version of pymc does not resolve it ??? the same error message continues to appear.

For headers, the type will be `type=string`. Still, the spec allows to specify the `format`, which can be `int32` in your case [0].

The addition of the field `format` in https://github.com/springwolf/springwolf-core/blob/193d53bc6e20d2b0c7c6f992c0dfc645ba56743b/springwolf-core/src/main/java/io/github/springwolf/core/asyncapi/scanners/common/annotation/AsyncAnnotationUtil.java#L68 is a good addition and thereby also the addition of the field as `format` to the Springwolf `Header` annotation.

I'd like to work on this issue. Is it available?
Thanks!

The current implementation displays all header fields as strings without any constraints. The issue is motivated by the need to provide a correct specification of the AsyncAPI for consumers.

issueDTO.title: serverManager controls fans but logs show SIGSEGV for ipmitool
issueDTO.description:
**Environment:**  
- Platform: Unraid OS 7.1.4
- Deployment: Docker Compose stack using Docker Compose Manager
- Image: `ghcr.io/danielv123/servermanager:latest`  
- Hardware: Dell R730xd  
- Stack config:  
  - Port mapping: `8083:8080`  
  - Volume mapping: ` /mnt/user/appdata/serverManager:/usr/src/app/data`  
  - Additional container: `ouroboros` for auto???updates  

---

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Deploy the stack in Unraid using Docker Compose.  
2. In the UI, add fan curves for the Dell R730xd.  
3. Navigate on the dashboard: the sensor data (temperatures, wattage, fan speeds) appears correctly.  
4. Open the **Logs** view.  
5. Observe errors in the logs (see attached/excerpt below).

---

**Expected Behavior:**  
- The UI should show correct sensor data.  
- The logs should reflect normal operations without error entries.

---

**Actual Behavior:**  
- UI shows correct sensor data (temperatures, wattage, fans).  
- However, the logs display error messages indicating something is wrong behind the scenes.

---

**Impact / Severity:**  
- **Medium** - The UI appears to work, but the log errors suggest hidden issues that may affect reliability or future operations.

---

**Attachments / Additional Info:**  
- Log excerpt:  

```
Error: Command failed: ipmitool -I lanplus -H idrac.home.lan -U idrac -P password sensor  
    at genericNodeError (node:internal/errors:985:15)  
    at wrappedFn (node:internal/errors:539:14)  
    at ChildProcess.exithandler (node:child_process:417:12)  
    at ChildProcess.emit (node:events:508:28)  
    at maybeClose (node:internal/child_process:1101:16)  
    at ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:305:5) {  
  code: null,  
  killed: false,  
  signal: 'SIGSEGV',  
  cmd: 'ipmitool -I lanplus -H idrac.home.lan -U idrac -P password sensor'  
}
```



Love the tool so far. Any ideas on what could be causing this?
comments:
Uh, thats a weird one. Looks like ipmitool is screwed up somehow?

Can you try with 

    docker pull ghcr.io/danielv123/servermanager@sha256:b8399fb2b1a067c2d8e6731b43daa739ce2593be3cbe8f34d1770b590c1c4009

this is the old image which I know for a fact has been working well for a long time (except for some config bugs, but those aren't relevant since you have already configured it)

> 
> Can you try with
> 
> ```
> docker pull ghcr.io/danielv123/servermanager@sha256:b8399fb2b1a067c2d8e6731b43daa739ce2593be3cbe8f34d1770b590c1c4009
> ```
> 
> this is the old image which I know for a fact has been working well for a long time (except for some config bugs, but those aren't relevant since you have already configured it)

I tested on windows and on Unraid and I did not see any ipmitool errors in the logs with this version.

I have the same issue, same logs, using Dockge on truenas, on a Dell T430. CPU Temperature was not displayed on the UI and the fan control was not reacting to the temperature increase. 
I can confirm that the "ghcr.io/danielv123/servermanager@sha256:b8399fb2b1a067c2d8e6731b43daa739ce2593be3cbe8f34d1770b590c1c4009" does not have the issue and working fine.
Thanks for the workaround and for the good work :)

issueDTO.title: Set up basic pytest unit tests for Ray service
issueDTO.description:
## Description

Currently, NDIF has very few tests written for it, with the barrier to entry being the lack of an existing testing framework. Getting basic unit tests set up with pytest will both help make it easier to start writing more tests and would set the foundations for developing a more diverse testing suite (integration, end-to-end, ..)

### Goal

Have a way of running unit tests (that can be run without spinning up the service). The following would meet the requirements of completing this ticket:

- From `src/services/ray`, have a pytest config, and be able to run unit tests from command line
- For now, just 3 basic unit tests + hello world. Don't bother mocking anything, just find existing classes or functions which have minimal dependencies and create some simple tests.
- Instructions on how to run tests added to [README](https://github.com/ndif-team/ndif/issues/169), and informative doc strings.


See the [Queue service](https://github.com/ndif-team/ndif/tree/main/src/services/queue) for an example of what this could look like (ignore the actual tests, they serve more as "proof of concept").

issueDTO.title: ability to convert inches to mm
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...]
Some times i get gcode that was done in imperial and when its imported into octoprint bettergrblesupport it assumes its metric so an object thats lets say 1 inch by 1 inch when windowed it is 1 mm by  1 mm this also affects the movement speeds.
**Describe the solution you'd like**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
The ability to change the reference measurements if it was imperial so it can convert to metric and be the correct size
**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
what I have been doing is importing into a gcode software as inches and converting to mm and resaving
**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
comments:
Please upload a GCode file for reference and to assist with understanding the nature of the issue you are reporting.

I have to say I'm at a loss as Grbl controls the means of measurement.  I'm guessing this is an aesthetic issue as you are correct in assuming I favor metric measurements.

[cutting board stand inches and mm.zip](https://github.com/synman/Octoprint-Bettergrblsupport/files/11182543/cutting.board.stand.inches.and.mm.zip)
I uploaded an example of the gcode in both units of measurement. When you window them you'll see what I mean by it doesn't detect imperial units.
adding the enhancement label to this.  I may look into imperial support in a future release.  thanks for the reference gcode.  it will help in determining what all is necessary once I get to it.

issueDTO.title: Noisy logging from docdb transaction cache lookup loops
issueDTO.description:
Jira Link: [DB-18631](https://yugabyte.atlassian.net/browse/DB-18631)

The transaction cache lookup code has a tight retry loop on transaction status lookup, but logs during a cache lookup retry at WARNING level which is too high volume for a cache miss.  This might actually be logging so aggressively that it impacts performance in extreme cases.

Specifically [this](https://github.com/yugabyte/yugabyte-db/blob/master/src/yb/docdb/transaction_status_cache.cc#L146) should be a VLOG(5) (since below logging the results of the lookup is a VLOG(4)
Conversely [this](https://github.com/yugabyte/yugabyte-db/blob/master/src/yb/docdb/transaction_status_cache.cc#L156) should be a WARNING not an INFO


[DB-18631]: https://yugabyte.atlassian.net/browse/DB-18631?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

issueDTO.title: Use riscv-dv for randomized core testing
issueDTO.description: [RISCV-DV](https://github.com/chipsalliance/riscv-dv) is an instruction generator, which can be used for automatic testing of RISC-V cores. For execution, our existing Verilator+cocotb solution can probably be adapted. To verify execution, results should be compared to a model, for example the [Sail model](https://github.com/riscv/sail-riscv).
comments: Another possibility is to use [Spike](https://github.com/riscv-software-src/riscv-isa-sim), which supports a huge number of extensions. Additionally maybe it can be worth to check if [Riscof](https://riscof.readthedocs.io/en/stable/) can be used.
Maybe we can look into integrating with already made solution for verification like https://github.com/OpenXiangShan/difftest ? It is made to integrate with other cores and looks interesting.

issueDTO.title: Implement `PBKDF2` across supported API
issueDTO.description:
# What?

Web Crypto API defines `PBKDF2` algorithm identifier (https://www.w3.org/TR/WebCryptoAPI/#pbkdf2) for operations like:
 
* Derive Bits (our implementation has it)
* Derive Key (in-progress grafana/xk6-webcrypto#83)
* Import key (our implementation has it)

Golang has an implementation in `x/crypto` https://pkg.go.dev/golang.org/x/crypto/pbkdf2.

We have to implement this support.

As part of the issue, probably following web platform tests (see [README](https://github.com/grafana/xk6-webcrypto/tree/main/webcrypto/tests)) should be enabled:
* WebCryptoAPI/derive_bits_keys/pbkdf2_vectors.js
* WebCryptoAPI/derive_bits_keys/pbkdf2.js
* and others test cases that could be useful for testing `PBKDF2`

# Why?

Having support of the `PBKDF2` makes our implementation compliant with web crypto API

@Krishiv-Mahajan Sure! Let me explain issue #2480 in detail.

## Issue Overview

**Title:** Add to company cyber dashboard: news about company  
**Type:** Feature Enhancement  
**Labels:** Good First Issue, $5 Bounty  
**Status:** Open

## What is the Company Cyber Dashboard?

The BLT application has a **Company/Domain Dashboard** that can be accessed at:
```
https://blt.owasp.org/domain/{company_name}/
```

This is a public dashboard that currently displays:
- **Company Information** - Logo, name, email, organization details
- **Recent Activity** - Lists of open and closed bug reports
- **Bug Reports** - Detailed list of security issues reported for that company
- **Top Bug Hunters** - Users who have reported the most bugs for that company

## What the Issue is Asking For

The issue wants you to **add a NEWS section** to this dashboard that displays news/announcements about the company. This would provide additional context and updates about the company alongside the bug reports.

## Technical Details

**Files you'll likely work with:**
- **View:** `website/views/organization.py` (specifically the `DomainDetailView` class)
- **Template:** `website/templates/domain.html`
- **Documentation:** `website/documents/BltCompanyDashboard.md`
- **Models:** You may need to check `website/models.py` to see if there's a News model, or you might need to integrate with an external news API

## Possible Implementation Approaches

1. **External News API Integration** - Fetch news about the company from external news APIs (like NewsAPI, Google News, etc.)
2. **Manual News Entry** - Create a News model and allow admins to add news items manually
3. **RSS Feed Integration** - Pull news from company RSS feeds or press release pages

## What Makes This a Good First Issue

- Clear scope: Add one new feature to an existing page
- Well-documented: The dashboard already has comprehensive documentation
- Good learning opportunity: You'll work with views, templates, and possibly external APIs
- Has a bounty: $5 reward upon completion

Would you like me to help you plan out the implementation approach or clarify any specific aspect of the issue?

issueDTO.title: add to_json method to BaseCappingTransformer
issueDTO.description:
What?
want to make it so that capping transformers can be dumped to/built from json - to do this just need to add a to_json method to BaseCappingTransformer which:

- calls super.to_json()
- adds the additional init attrs (capping_values, quantiles, weights_column) to this  dict
- adds the additional fit attrs to this dict (quantile_capping_values and _replacement_values)

Then need to add test cases for transforms with to/from json-ed transformers - this can be done fairly easily with parametrise and following the example in this PR https://github.com/azukds/tubular/pull/496

Will need to:
- set the jsonable class attr to True
- add the `block_from_json` decorator to any instance methods that are not needed for transform
- set up and transform tests for this class to do an additional run for json'd transformers, following the PR example

Why?
Provide a more readable and env independent way of storing pipelines/transformers
