issueDTO.title: Setting the scale of a collision shape of a characterbody2d to be negative breaks the shape
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**

Setting the scale of a CharacterBody2D to be negative (e.g.,(-1, 1)) causes the collision shape to break. The character body passes through other objects, but seems to stop at the center, almost as if the shape has been reduced to a point. Interestingly, setting the scale on both axes to be negative (such as (-1, -1)) avoids the issue. This also does not seem to only apply to characterbody2d, not to other physics objects, which makes me think it may be a bug with the move_and_slide function. Could be related to #354.

**To Reproduce**

* Create a CharacterBody2D node with a CollisionShape2D
* Set the scale of the collision shape along the x- or y- axis to a negative number
* Move the characterbody using move_and_slide
* The shape should no longer collide with objects except at its center.

**Expected behavior**

The collision shape should stop the object well before it reaches the center

**Environment:**
 - OS: Linux (although similar behaviout appears to occur on windows)
 - Version: v0.8.10\
 -  Godot Version: 4.5
 - Type: simd 2d (from the godot asset lib)

**Example project(zip)**

[Rapier bug.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/23047139/Rapier.bug.zip)
comments: My guess is when changing scale, instead of changing scale I am destroying/recreating the shape. Fix would be, if that is the case, to just change scale (and then the body shouldn't pass through anymore). Need to investigate though, but I am able to reproduce the issue

repository.description: Godot Rapier Physics ??? 2D and 3D physics engine for the Godot game engine. with better stability, performance, liquids, determinism, state serialization and no ghost collisions.
repository.name: godot-rapier-physics

summary.main: Setting the scale of a CharacterBody2D to be negative (e.g.,(-1, 1)) causes the collision shape to break, the character body passes through other objects, but seems to stop at the center, almost as if the shape has been reduced to a point
summary.validationOrRequirement: Create a CharacterBody2D node with a CollisionShape2D, set the scale of the collision shape along the x- or y- axis to a negative number, move the characterbody using move_and_slide, the shape should no longer collide with objects except at its center
summary.attemptedFixes: My guess is when changing scale, instead of changing scale I am destroying/recreating the shape. Fix would be, if that is the case, to just change scale (and then the body shouldn't pass through anymore). Need to investigate though, but I am able to reproduce the issue
summary.otherNotes: Related to #354, issue seems to be specific to CharacterBody2D, not other physics objects, and may be related to move_and_slide function

issueDTO.title: Provide a one liner to sync with electrum
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the enhancement**  

Currently there is a lot of boilerplate needed to sync a wallet with electrum, it would be great to have one function that lets you pass in a mutable reference to a wallet and then have it update its internals with block data.

It used to be much easier to sync with electrum in the prior versions of bdk, it would be great to have a return to that simplicity.

**Use case**  

load a wallet, then sync it with electrum to get block data with a single line of code

**Additional context**

I personally think a builder method and some macros/convinience functions built on top of that would work well, I usually just want a full scan no matter what but every once in a while I'll need a fast sync. 

```rust
  ElectrumBuilder::new(wallet)
          .url("tcp://electrum.blockstream.info:50001")
          .network(NETWORK)
          .stop_gap(25)
          .batch_size(30)
          .fast_sync() 
          .fetch_prev_txouts()
          .request()?;
```

I'll bring this up in the Thursday meeting with @evanlinjin since I know he is working with electrum.

Yes, assigned to you.

issueDTO.title: Terminal: highlighted (matched) search term CONSTANTLY overwrites clipboard
issueDTO.description:
<!-- ???????????? Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ???????????? -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
Version: 1.105.1 (Universal)
Commit: 7d842fb85a0275a4a8e4d7e040d2625abbf7f084
Date: 2025-10-14T22:33:36.618Z
Electron: 37.6.0
ElectronBuildId: 12502201
Chromium: 138.0.7204.251
Node.js: 22.19.0
V8: 13.8.258.32-electron.0
OS: Darwin x64 23.6.0

- OS Version: 
MacOS Sonoma 14.7.7 (23H723)


This looks like https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/151902 is still unfixed despite 4 years in making and being closed. 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Search for a term in Terminal pane
2. Copy something into clipboard (not necessarily inside the Terminal pane, as in the video repro below)
3. Paste the copied term into the terminal _(or simply, interact with the terminal in any way),_ then paste again, and observe  that the clipboard item has been overwritten by your previous search term from the terminal.

To clarify: pasting action is not necessary to lose clipboard contents, it is simply for repro purposes. In real life scenarios, any interaction with the Terminal pane can replace clipboard if terminal search field is open and populated.

The way I see it, is that searching highlights found items (in terminal pane), and this highlighting acts as if user has selected something, hence copy-on-select is triggered and clipboard is replaced with the found / highlighted string.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/052fe079-3c7c-4c21-b36b-fd113ba0377d
comments: @Tyriar This has been a bug for 4+ years, how is still backlogged???
@movy this needs to be prioritized against the 13k other open issues. You're welcome to give us a hand and try fix it if you're passionate.
@Tyriar @movy Hi, I???d like to take a shot at fixing this issue, could you assign it to me.
If @vidmt steps away from the issue, I'd love to take a swing at it!

I'm not sure if this bug exist.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/467e4a4b-a724-438c-b1af-e5ae303d4a42

Are you @movy sure you have `terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection` to false on both user and workspace setting? 

If you have `terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection` enabled, then its expected that your highlighted term in terminal will be copied.

@anthonykim1, 
My `terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection` has been set to `true` for 25 years, but the way it is supposed to work is it _copies on selection_, i.e. user selected text -> it is copied to the clipboard, and it works as expected in VSCode terminal pane.

This issue is about unwanted behaviour when **highlighted** text (by search item) gets copied even when user does not select anything. If you select something, then paste it, selection gets deselected, i.e. it is certainly not the issue here.

I am not familiar with the codebase, and while it feels like it is related to `terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection`, the **selection is being triggered by search item** IS the unwanted behaviour, and `copyOnSelection` just works as expected in such unexpected scenario.

I am on Windows using Zsh, i tried exactly what you did but it seems everything works correctly i would assume then its macOS related bug.
I will try to fix that problem.

summary.otherNotes: This issue is about unwanted behavior when highlighted text (by search item) gets copied even when user does not select anything. It is not related to the expected behavior of `terminal.integrated.copyOnSelection`.

Purpose:

Mandatory arguments:
        LIBRARY_PATH            XML library file path listing ZIM file to serve. To be used only with the
 --library argument.
        ZIM_PATH                ZIM file path(s)
```
The + and the (s) are the hints for many  files.
Maybe something like the following is more obvious:
```
kiwix-serve [OPTIONS] ZIM_PATH [ZIM_PATH...]
```

Hello,for me kiwix-serve shows

```

It's still problematic because ` kiwix-serve [options] ZIMPATH ...` is not the same as ` kiwix-serve [options] ZIMPATH...` IMO
IMO this is the best help message we can get without changing docopt source

@vighnesh-sawant Thank you for pushing this issue, but please don't mix thins with #764 in your PR. Try to make one PR for one issue.

Considering the comment of @veloman-yunkan on the PR  https://github.com/kiwix/kiwix-tools/pull/763#discussion_r2378819848, it seems to me that Docopt is in charge of building the steing for the `usage()`. Therefore we have (1) no control on it (2) different version of Docopt might display slightly different things.

To conclude, here it sounds there might not much we can do. Maybe check the man page for j
kiwix-serve to see if it oooks good there?... and close the issue.

> it seems to me that Docopt is in charge of building the steing for the `usage()`. Therefore we have (1) no control on it (2) different version of Docopt might display slightly different things.

It's a little different. The usage string is written by the programmer, and is passed to Docopt for deducing the supported syntax of the command line, so the usage string must meed the requirements (format) imposed by Docopt.

@veloman-yunkan To me this has pretty much the same consequence: `kiwix-serve [OPTIONS] ZIM_PATH+` is the docopt chosen way to represent multiple (ZIM path) inputs and we have no clean way to change that. I will close except someone propose a patch to achieve that.

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to provide a clear help message for kiwix-serve on how to use multiple ZIM files.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The usage string must meet the requirements imposed by Docopt, and different versions of Docopt might display slightly different things.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author suggests checking the man page for kiwix-serve to see if it looks good there, and closing the issue. @veloman-yunkan also suggests that the usage string is written by the programmer and is passed to Docopt for deducing the supported syntax of the command line, so the usage string must meet the requirements imposed by Docopt.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about the help message of kiwix-serve not being clear on how to use multiple ZIM files. The user wants to serve many ZIM files, but kiwix-serve seems to be for one file. The issue is related to the usage string of kiwix-serve, which is written by the programmer and is passed to Docopt for deducing the supported syntax of the command line. The issue is closed as it seems that there is no clean way to change the usage string to represent multiple ZIM path inputs.

issueDTO.title: Undocumented feature
issueDTO.description:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have read the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542).
- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report, otherwise it will be closed.
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### 1. Is this request related to a challenge you're experiencing? Tell me about your story.

It is possible to execute workflow runs on specific versions, hence there's a copy ID action in the history menu.

But it is not documented in the API page, how to use that feature

### 2. Additional context or comments

_No response_

### 3. Can you help us with this feature?

- [ ] I am interested in contributing to this feature.
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
You can execute workflow or chatflow runs on specific versions in Dify by using the workflow version ID (copied via the "Copy ID" action in the version history menu) as the `workflow_id` parameter in relevant API calls. This feature was added in [PR #23188](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/pull/23188).

For workflows, use the endpoint:

```
POST /v1/workflows/run
```

Include the `workflow_id` in your JSON payload:

```json
{
  "inputs": { /* your workflow inputs */ },
  "workflow_id": "YOUR_VERSION_ID"
}
```

For chatflows, use:

```
POST /v1/chat-messages
```

with the same `workflow_id` parameter in the body.

If you omit `workflow_id`, the API uses the default published version. If you provide an invalid or draft version ID, you'll get an error (`workflow_not_found`, `draft_workflow_error`, or `workflow_id_format_error`) [source](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/pull/23188).

You can get the version ID from the UI's version history panel using "Copy ID". This ID is a UUID and should be pasted directly into your API request.

For more details, see the updated API documentation and the merged PR for examples and error handling [source](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/pull/23188).

issueDTO.title: `build_firedrake_main.yml` installs Spyro via pip instead of using the checked-out code
issueDTO.description:
After PR #189, I noticed that our `build_firedrake_main.yml` workflow does **not** test the Spyro code from the pull request. Instead, the workflow installs spyro via pip to the GitHub repo.

This means build_firedrake_main part of our CI is always testing **spyro from `main`**, not the code in the PR branch. This bug only affects that part of our CI, not our python tests section (which uses release Firedrake).

Because of this:

* CI can **pass even when the PR introduces breakage occuring in Firedrake main**, since it is not actually tested.
* Compatibility issues with Firedrake main only show up **after merging**.
* New contributors may believe CI validates their changes when it does not.
* Because most of our users (and devs) use a Firedrake release version instead of main we don't notice.

**What should happen instead:**

The CI should: use the **checked-out** spyro source from the PR.

This ensures CI is testing the *actual* code in the PR.

**Benefit:**

* CI becomes reliable and catches issues before merging.
* Clearer behavior for contributors learning CI workflows.
* Avoids silent breakage when Firedrake main updates.

---

### ??? *Good First Issue Checklist*

* [ ] Open `.github/workflows/build_firedrake_main.yml`
* [ ] Find the step that installs pyro
* [ ] Remove that pip install step
* [ ] Ensure spyro is installed from the checked-out source instead (This should occur *before* running any tests.)
* [ ] Run the workflow locally (optional: using `act`) or open a PR to trigger CI and verify the fix
* [ ] Submit PR

**No change is needed to our main python-tests.yml file in our CI**. Therefore, whoever fixes this can just use the other .yml as an example of what to do.

@Olender I have started working on the issue

comments: @tomsun28 Hi! I was wondering if this issue has already been resolved in recent commits. If not, I???d like to give it a try.
@Saramanda9988 Hi, this is not be resolved, welcome. Could you describe your proposed approach before starting?

@tomsun28 Sure!
I believe the instance label should represent the actual monitored target. Using IP:Port makes the metrics easier to identify and correlate, and aligns well with Prometheus labeling conventions.
I considered using instanceName, but since it may not always map directly to the actual target, I think IP:Port would be a more reliable choice.
If this approach looks good to you, I???ll submit a PR soon. Please let me know if you have any suggestions or concerns!

Hi @tomsun28 and community, I???ve been investigating this issue and found that the host value currently only includes the IP (e.g. 127.0.0.1), not the full IP:Port The MetricsData metadata contains only instancehost and instancename, without any port information.Each monitorTask has a globally unique id and name. Given this, there seem to be a few possible approaches: 1. Modify host to include ip:port, so that the instance label directly matches Prometheus best practices. Or add a port field in metadata allowing ip:port to be reconstructed later ??? but these may introduce larger structural changes. 2. Use instancename as the instance label, which requires minimal modification but doesn???t fully align with Prometheus conventions. Before proceeding with a PR, I???d like to hear your thoughts, Any suggestions from the community would be greatly appreciated.

Hi, @Saramanda9988 sorry for slow response. the reason there's no `port` is because monitoring type like `ping` don't require a port number.  I'll look into this and get back to you, because any changes to this will have a long-lasting impact.
thanks and welcome to discuss.

Thanks for the reply, @tomsun28 !
I???ll wait for your further thoughts on this and I???m happy to adjust my approach once you???ve reviewed it.
Please let me know if there???s anything I can help test or verify!

hi, how about this refactor.
In `Monitor`, change the `host` into `instance`, the `instance` value is host:port, the `ping` monitor's `instance` value is host.
Because the monitor params also has the host value, so we can change `Monitor` host.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3932d7e2-2fba-4216-8135-1f67f5b2d925)

Then change the metadata `instancehost` into `instance`, the value is from the monitor instance.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e700162d-766e-41e5-91f4-3bb9736117da)

The we can save the instance as promethues instance into TSDB like victormetrics or greptimedb.
Also we need update the metrics query, from using the monitorId to match value to using the instance.

Hi,I think the refactor makes sense. It is feasible and more maintainable in the long run. However, it might introduce some breaking changes ??? for example, existing users might need to perform data migration after upgrading.

In addition, some frontend code and test logic may also need corresponding updates.

Before I proceed to explore this direction further, I???d like to confirm: do you think it???s acceptable to make such structural adjustments at this stage of the project?

issueDTO.title: #pragma init_seg(section-specifier, func-name) not supported
issueDTO.description:
This MSVC pragma is only partially implemented.  As detailed here, there is functionality to specify a function to call in place of atexit.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/preprocessor/init-seg?view=msvc-170

"func-name
Specifies a function to be called in place of atexit when the program exits. This helper function also calls [atexit](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/c-runtime-library/reference/atexit?view=msvc-170) with a pointer to the destructor for the global object. If you specify a function identifier in the pragma of the form,

C++

Copy
int __cdecl myexit (void (__cdecl *pf)(void))
then your function will be called instead of the C run-time library's atexit. It allows you to build a list of the destructors to call when you're ready to destroy the objects."

Relevant code in ParsePragma.cpp:Parser::HandlePragmaMSInitSeg:
    // FIXME: Add support for the '[, func-name]' part of the pragma.

Maybe a good early OSS contribution given the limited use and lack of potential for regression

Specifies a function to be called in place of atexit when the program exits. This helper function also calls [atexit](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/c-runtime-library/reference/atexit?view=msvc-170) with a pointer to the destructor for the global object. If you specify a function identifier in the pragma of the form,

C++

Copy
int __cdecl myexit (void (__cdecl *pf)(void))
then your function will be called instead of the C run-time library's atexit. It allows you to build a list of the destructors to call when you're ready to destroy the objects."

Relevant code in ParsePragma.cpp:Parser::HandlePragmaMSInitSeg:
    // FIXME: Add support for the '[, func-name]' part of the pragma.

Maybe a good early OSS contribution given the limited use and lack of potential for regression

</details>

Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

issueDTO.description:
Hi there,

I have some questions regarding the Terra Packages repository for Fedora Linux.

1. Considering RPM Fusion seems to be more popular and potentially the one that has more quality assurance (even some upstream Fedora devs have accounts there), and also is the one mentioned in the official Fedora's repos, wouldn't it more benefitial to merge your work with RPM Fusion instead of duplicating it?
2. Fedora's focus is on Flatpak. Eventually, RPM Fusion and Terra will become obsolete for certain packages (you could argue that, for instance, OBS Studio's best version is from Flatpak, since it's mantained directly by the devs). What is the team's plan on this?
3. From what I've understood, it seems you guys also replicate some of the packages from RPM Fusion. Wouldn't it be better to follow the RPM Fusion's principle of extension of Fedora repos? In other words: RPM Fusion expands Fedora's upstream (without providing what upstream already provides), so wouldn't it make more sense for Terra to be a central kind of an Arch Linux User Repository and only provide what Fedora and RPM Fusion don't already provide?
4. Considering COPR exists, wouldn't it make more sense to merge Terra's work into COPR somehow? (Considering RPM Fusion would not be wanted.) I think it creates too much division and leaves Terra in the dark ("cool apps for the out-of-the-norm kids" kind of vibe).

Pardon my ignorance in such questions, but I'm trying to understand why would I (or any other user) want to use Terra. I personally try to avoid Flatpaks, so if Terra can help me with that I would like to use it, but like I said earlier it seems Terra duplicates work that conflict with packages from upstream and RPM Fusion, and also there's too many places to get packages then (Fedora, RPM Fusion, Terra, COPR...).

Many thanks for your attention and I wish you a good weekend.
comments: FYRA-394

Thank you for this issue. I honestly think it's pretty good to have these questions to clear up what our community thinks of us. Well, some of these questions are addressed in our [devdocs](https://developer.fyralabs.com/terra/faq) though (especially on why we do not replace RPM Fusion). Of course, I will also add your questions to that page later.

1. It is impossible to merge with RPM Fusion. Why? Because we are fundamentally different in infrastructure, release model, and our intention.
  - The infrastructure is documented [here](https://developer.fyralabs.com/terra/infrastructure). As you can see, it is way easier to find differences than to find similarities in our build infrastructure. The reason for such difference is very simple: we made it *to replace koji and its neighbouring components*. We believe our infrastructure is superior to Fedora and RPM Fusion, and this is proven by the fact that we have more packages and the repository is going well while having way less maintainers to the point you can count them all by your fingers.
  - Our release model is rolling (compared to stable for Fedora and Fusion). One of the core mechanisms in Terra is automatic updates. You always get the latest packages. Since the implementation, our packages that track Fedora versions (e.g. mesa) has never failed to disappoint dnf, while the RPM Fusion version constantly forces dnf to scream about dependency issues. There's practically no reason to use their version over ours.
  - Our intention is quite ambitious. We documented the behaviour and macros of RPM. We allow people to contribute anonymously. The infrastructure is way more modern and transparent so that we can attract more people in and outside of the Fedora ecosystem to contribute. We want to overcome the challenges we see in RPM Fusion, while that being only part of our objectives. The point of this project ultimately is not to replace RPM Fusion, it is to improve Fedora in general.
2. First of all, Fedora's main focus in fact is never on Flatpaks. If that was the case, Fedora Flatpaks would not exist. Second of all, you cannot package many of our packages as Flatpaks, because (a) we have a guideline that prevents people from packaging things that work as Flatpaks, and (b) system components cannot be packaged as Flatpaks. Therefore, neither RPM Fusion nor Terra will be replaced in the foreseeable future for this reason.
3. Answered in question 1.
4. Partly answered in question 1. COPR is basically, as you have mentioned, an AUR. Terra is not an AUR, it is a reviewed and automatic AUR. It's more like an unofficial community (rip)/extra repository. Also, we have mirrors, and it's 1 repository replacing dozens of COPRs.

Hi there, many thanks for your detailed response. I appreciate it.

I think what could be done from now on would be things to improve this repository's popularity and get more users to use it.

I think you could start by improving the docs for a more user-focused approach (e.g. the Welcome page could be a How-To for installation instead of it being a separate one).

Maybe get in touch with official Fedora upstream to see if they wanna mention your repos in their docs? For example, they mention RPM Fusion in the quick docs section: https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/quick-docs/rpmfusion-setup/

Thanks for your attention once again.

Do you mind if I rename this issue to something like "Relationship to RPMFusion and Fedora repositories?" This actually sounds like a really good issue and we'd like to pin it, and also possibly add these answers to our documentation later.
Feel free too! Sounds good to me.

issueDTO.title: Try alternative graph database
issueDTO.description:
## Issue

### **What is the issue?**

Gap analysis calculation takes a few hours if we run it on a beefy machine. The bottleneck is neo4j being slow.
We should investigate alternatives.
An alternative that seems promising and works with our existing database is [Apache  Age](https://age.apache.org/age-manual/master/intro/setup.html)

Age runs on top of our current database (postgres) and allows for Cypher queries on top of postgres.
I'm being told it is faster than neo

issueDTO.title: URL validation in documentation (mkdocs)
issueDTO.description:
## Issue description / feature objectives

See https://github.com/oscal-compass/compliance-trestle/issues/1919 where 2 URLs were added to the ignore list for mkdocs as a work-around.

mkdocs uses htmlproofer as a plug-in to verify URL aliveness. Recently, 2 URLs failed htmlproofer access, causing the trestle validation pipeline to fail for all newly submitted trestle PRs. The work-around was to have htmlproofer skip these 2 URLs.

Find a way to have mkdocs/htmlproofer not fail these links or find an alternative way to validate them.

## Caveats / Assumptions

N/A

## Completion Criteria

The links are validated.
comments:
Reproduced the issue and did some research on what can be done to solve it. Seems like it might be better to switch to another URL validation tool like [markdown-link-check](https://www.npmjs.com/package/markdown-link-check) or [lychee](https://github.com/lycheeverse/lychee)

These tools seem to be better at handling validation errors with urls that return 404 (similar to FedRAMP link) or asset urls (similar to the CNCF SVG link)

trestle uses mkdocs. mkdocs uses htmlproofer. mkdocs would need to support
a a different plugin, i think.

issueDTO.title: Input validation missing on import csv functionality
issueDTO.description:
## Issue

When importing a new standard, no validation is performed on the imported csv file, a generic non-descriptive "500 - Internal Server Error" is returned or new CREs are wrongfully injected. 

More specifically, in the outlined case, if the format of "CRE 0" column is XX-XXX|<description> instead of XXX-XXX|<description>, a non-descriptive error is returned. Also, I noticed that if in the "<standard_name>|name" column the requirement's text is enclosed between three double quotes '"""', the csv is treated as valid and the whole row is entered as a new root CRE. 

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/086cbb7c-eff1-493b-873f-1aad1e087f99)
comments:
Hi  ,@northdpole , @filipposfwt

I have reviewed the issue and identified the missing input validation in the CSV import functionality. I plan to implement validation checks for headers, data formats, and security measures (such as preventing CSV injection). I will also ensure proper error handling and testing before submitting a fix.

Please assign this issue to me so I can start working on it. Let me know if you have any specific requirements or suggestions.

Thanks!
@Hardik301002 just assigned
Hi! I noticed there hasn???t been any activity here recently. If it???s okay, I???d like to work on this issue. Could you please assign it to me if it???s available?

summary.main: Implement input validation on the import CSV functionality to prevent incorrect data injection and improve error handling.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Headers, data formats, and security measures need to be validated, specifically for the 'CRE 0' column format and the use of double quotes in the '<standard_name>|name' column.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author has reviewed the issue and plans to implement validation checks for headers, data formats, and security measures, as well as proper error handling and testing.
summary.otherNotes: The issue description includes a screenshot of an image and mentions a specific requirement for the 'CRE 0' column format and the use of double quotes in the '<standard_name>|name' column.

- Submitting a [draft pull request](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/about-pull-requests#draft-pull-requests) with your progress within 11 days
- Asking for the **📌 Pinned** label if you need more time
</details>

We appreciate your contribution and are here to help if needed!

issueDTO.title: Basic accessibility web features
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [X] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

To begin with, it is a great product. In its current state, it seems advisable to generate a final web page with considerations for web accessibility. This includes aspects such as the page name, language, structure, and named links. Currently, these tags cannot be controlled and may result in errors or warnings in accessible web page verification tools.

### Why?

The product is described as excellent. However, it lacks certain features related to web accessibility. Enhancing web accessibility can improve user experience and ensure compliance with accessibility standards. This proactive approach can also prevent errors and warnings in verification tools.

### How?

To address this, efforts should be made to generate a final web page that incorporates aspects of web accessibility. This may involve adjusting tags related to page name, language, structure, and links to comply with accessibility guidelines. By implementing these changes, errors and warnings in verification tools can be minimized, thereby improving the overall accessibility and usability of the web page.

### Additional Context

I know there are some questions in forums about compatibility e.g. with 508 standards (https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/508-compliance-for-streamlit/13579) which of course would be great but my recommendation would be to start with simple compatibilities that do not incorporate too much development overhead, or diminish Stremlit's capabilities.
comments:
**To help Streamlit prioritize this feature, react with a 👍 (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your vote helps us identify which enhancements matter most to our users.

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-8399)

Hi, We are currently working on an accessibility project and encountered an issue with two unlabeled buttons in the Streamlit UI. Specifically, these are the "close sidebar" button and the "three-dotted" menu button. We hope the Streamlit team addresses these accessibility concerns. The product is excellent, but it could greatly benefit from improved accessibility features.

Hi,

I'd like to volunteer to address these 2 unlabelled buttons (plus the 3rd "expand sidebar" button). I am a frontend developer with experience in accessibility.

As per the contributing guidelines I'll wait for confirmation here from the Streamlit team before submitting a PR. Thanks.

I can't emphasize enough how important it is to have Section 508 compliance for the platform for government use. The platform is missing out on a huge business opportunity with Gov sector if it relies on clicks by users to gauge the importance of this request.

I would suggest this issue/ticket should be labelled as a "bug fix" rather than an "enhancement". Just to add, for the Streamlit team, that my offer to fix these stands, with the hope that I can then look at other accessibility issues following this work. Please do let me know if it's okay to submit a PR.

Adding to this to agree with the previous posts that this is incredibly important for government work and Streamlit would greatly benefit from addressing this (thank you to @KevinEtchells for the offer for development, I hope they take you up on it!)

As a Senior Solutions Architect with a large Government consulting firm.  I want to add in on the agreement. Streamlit will ultimately be sidelined, even by the data scientists, if the end results cant be presented with 508 compliance.  RFPs from government agencies have largely begun boilerplate 508 compliance into all of their requests. Which will immediately disqualify this fantastic product from government use.

At least update the top-right menu? axe checker says:
- Elements must only use supported ARIA attributes. The span isn???t the toggle ??? the button is; move aria-expanded and aria-haspopup onto the button itself.
- Buttons must have discernable text. Give the button an informative aria-label.

The suggestions are from ChatGPT, but it's a bug, please fix.

@KevinEtchells sorry, hadn't seen your post! Please feel free to make PRs ??? especially for things like this that just fix existing features and don't add new features or APIs, we're very likely to merge them.
I'm eager if these concerns have been prioritized by streamlit. I would like to avail Accessibility features given I'm blind tech founder and now into leveraging AI technologies.

issueDTO.title: MyOpenCRE: create frontend
issueDTO.description:
MyOpenCRE is a year old at this point. The API seems to have reasonable stability and to work as expected.

Time to make a frontend for it so that interested parties can use it without curl.

Acceptance criteria:
Make a set of new pages and buttons linked to by the main page that allow users to:
* download a CSV with all the CREs currently in the DB
* upload a CSV with one or more standards mapped to CREs and allow the application to import them.


User journey:
* user who has "Standard A" (assume standard is SOC2 for example)
* user want to map "Standard A" to other standards but they don't have the capacity to do so manually
* user splits "Standard A" into controls or sections
* user visits myopencre.org and clicks: "myOpenCRE"
* user can download a mapping spreadsheet template using a button
* user can then map "Standard A" to CREs in their spreadsheet
* user can then upload their spreadsheet by either drag n drop or by selecting a file on their computer
* The CRE platform then imports their spreadsheet and notifies the user via a browser notification when the import is done
* User can then use "Standard A" in OpenCRE normally

This feature needs to be able to be turned on or off (aka feature flagged ).
Heroku does not have enough resources to calculate gap analysis etc for a full standard and we don't want this getting abused with irrelevant standards. 

For local execution this should allow people to import a full standard. For heroku the ability to Upload a standard should be turned off.

Let me know, and I'll proceed accordingly. You can assign this issue to me.

issueDTO.title: `/setpassword` can lock you out of your singleplayer world
issueDTO.description: ### Luanti version ```true 5.14.0 ``` ### Summary this is similar to #14457 the default auth handler for singleplayer should just be completely disabled ### Steps to reproduce 1. create a singleplayer world 2. do `/grantme password` 3. do `/setpassword singleplayer foobar` 4. leave and rejoin 5.
comments: Whether the auth handler is disabled or not, `/setpassword` should probably not be registered in singleplayer. It serves no purpose.

comments:
Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.


@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

issueDTO.title: Avoid throwing System.Exception directly in user code
issueDTO.description:
## What version of FlowSynx?
> 1.2.2

## Describe the bug
**File:** `plugins/FlowSynx.Plugins.LocalFileSystem/Services/LocalFileManager.cs`
**Lines:** `99, 102, 119, 122, 125, 139, 153, 156, 159, 179, 182, 185, 204, 207, 210, 228, 231, 255, 263, 270, 277, 338, 341, 346`

Currently, the code throws a general System.Exception:

```csharp
throw new Exception(Resources.something);
```

Throwing **System.Exception** directly is discouraged because it is too generic and makes error handling harder.

## Suggested Fix (example)

```csharp
if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(path))
{
    throw new ArgumentException(Resources.something,);
}
```
Do it for all lines aboved-mentioned.

## Benefits
- Improves code clarity and debugging.
- Allows consumers to catch more specific exceptions.
- Follows .NET best practices.

repository.description: Seamless Workflow Automation - Declarative, Extensible, and Fully Controllable
repository.name: flowsynx

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to refactor the code in LocalFileManager.cs to avoid throwing System.Exception directly and instead throw more specific exceptions.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires the code to be refactored to throw more specific exceptions, following .NET best practices, and improving code clarity and debugging.
summary.attemptedFixes: The suggested fix is to throw more specific exceptions, for example, ArgumentException, for each of the lines mentioned.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about avoiding throwing System.Exception directly in user code, specifically in the LocalFileManager.cs file. The current code throws a general System.Exception, which is discouraged due to its generic nature and makes error handling harder. The suggested fix is to throw more specific exceptions.

issueDTO.title: Real-time Ubuntu: Add Questing Quokka to list of releases
issueDTO.description:
### What is this task about?

The [Real-time Ubuntu releases](https://documentation.ubuntu.com/real-time/latest/reference/releases/) page needs to be updated with information of the latest interim release.

Details about the latest interim release can be found here: https://ubuntu.com/about/release-cycle
Details about the latest kernel version can be found here: https://ubuntu.com/kernel/lifecycle

_Did you know?_

_- The linux-realtime kernel version is the same base kernel version used in the Ubuntu generic kernel for a given release._
_- You can also get the exact linux-realtime kernel version from [linux-realtime repository in Launchpad](https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-realtime)._

### Want to work on this?

If you are interested, please let me know in a reply to this issue.

Once you are assigned the issue, you can submit a PR against the [real-time-ubuntu-docs repository](https://github.com/canonical/real-time-ubuntu-docs).

You will need to have signed the CLA to contribute to the repo.

Please feel free to reach out to me on [Matrix](https://matrix.to/#/@annecyh:ubuntu.com) if you have further questions while working on this issue.

Thanks!

P/S: If you are new to Matrix, see the guide on [getting started with Matrix](https://ubuntu.com/community/docs/communications/matrix/onboarding).

issueDTO.title: Batch import of Q&A pairs failed.
issueDTO.description: ### Self Checks - [x] I have read the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542). - [x] This is only for bug report, if you would like to ask a question, please head to [Discussions](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/discussions/categories/general). - [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones. - [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report, otherwise it will be closed. - [x] ??????????????? & Non English User????????????????????????????????????????????? ?????? - [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields. ### Dify version 1.9.1 ### Cloud or Self Hosted Self Hosted (Docker) ### Steps to reproduce ### ?????? Expected Behavior In version 1.8.x, the batch import for Q&A sets works correctly. However, in version 1.9.1, the import fails. The interface displays a completion message, but no data is actually imported. We hope this bug can be fixed soon.??? ### ??? Actual Behavior _No response_
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This is a confirmed regression in Dify v1.9.1: batch import of Q&A pairs via CSV appears to succeed in the UI, but no data is actually imported. This issue has been reported by other users as well, especially in self-hosted Docker environments, and matches your experience where the completion message is shown but the data is missing [[example issue](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/20043)].

Recent code changes in v1.9.1 refactored the batch import backend, specifically how database sessions are managed in the batch import task. The refactor replaced explicit session context management with direct use of a global session object, which may have introduced subtle bugs???especially if the session is closed or rolled back unexpectedly during async processing [[see PR #26795](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/pull/26795)]. There are also known issues with session management and pipeline template seeding in self-hosted setups that can cause silent failures [[reference](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/26656)].

**What you can do:**
- Check your backend logs for errors during the import process, especially any SQLAlchemy session or commit errors.
- Make sure your Docker environment has the correct configuration for batch limits (`UPLOAD_FILE_BATCH_LIMIT`, `BATCH_UPLOAD_LIMIT`), and that your database is seeded with required pipeline templates if you are running offline.
- As a temporary workaround, some users have reverted to v1.8.x or patched the session management code to use explicit session scopes for the batch import task.
- There is no universal fix yet, but tracking the logs and sharing any backend errors will help maintainers identify the root cause faster.

If you need to unblock your workflow urgently, consider rolling back to v1.8.x until a fix is released.

comments:
there should be a docker lib for these unit formatting scenarios: https://github.com/docker/go-units
Hi! I'm new to this codebase but after @ericcurtin's encouragement, wanted to give this a shot. I've implemented a fix (which works on my machine :) ) for the inconsistent unit formatting issue. Would love to get feedback before opening a PR!

## Approach

I've standardized unit formatting by removing spaces between numbers and units for both GGUF and Safetensors models.

**For Safetensors** (`pkg/distribution/internal/safetensors/metadata.go`):
- Removed spaces from `formatParameters()` unit arrays (`" K"` ??? `"K"`, `" M"` ??? `"M"`)
- Switched `formatSize()` to use `units.BytesSize()` instead of `HumanSizeWithPrecision()` + post-processing
  - `BytesSize()` outputs without spaces, uses binary units (MiB/GiB), and avoids scientific notation

**For GGUF** (`pkg/distribution/internal/gguf/create.go`):
- Added `normalizeUnitString()` using regex to remove spaces between numbers and units
- Applied to both `Parameters` and `Size` fields
- Handles all cases: `"409M"` (unchanged), `"361.82 M"` ??? `"361.82M"`, `"256.35 MiB"` ??? `"256.35MiB"`

**Tests**: Updated expectations in both `model_test.go` files to match new format.

## Why This Approach?

I used a hybrid approach because:
- **Safetensors**: We control formatting, so `BytesSize()` gives clean output directly
- **GGUF**: The parser already provides formatted strings, so regex normalization (pattern: `([0-9.]+)\s+([A-Za-z]+)`) may be more efficient than re-parsing/reformatting (avoids type conversion errors, preserves original format)

After testing, `BytesSize()` is better than `HumanSizeWithPrecision()` because it has no spaces, no scientific notation, uses accurate binary units, and requires just one function call.

## Results

**Before:**
```
PARAMETERS  SIZE
409M        437M
361.82 M    256.35 MiB
134.52 M    82.41 MiB
```

**After:**
```
PARAMETERS  SIZE
409M        437M
361.82M     256MiB
134.52M     82.41MiB
```

Now `awk '{print $6}'` works correctly for all models! 🎉

**Files I've touched:**
- `pkg/distribution/internal/safetensors/metadata.go`
- `pkg/distribution/internal/gguf/create.go`
- `pkg/distribution/internal/safetensors/model_test.go`
- `pkg/distribution/internal/gguf/model_test.go`

Since I'm still learning the codebase, I'd really appreciate any feedback on this approach. Does this align with the project's style? Any concerns or suggestions? If this looks good, I'll create a PR! Thanks!

issueDTO.description:
The PR https://github.com/trixi-framework/Trixi.jl/pull/2458/files swaps out Trixi.jl's old wave-speed estimate for a better wave-speed estimate. However, because this would break a lot of CI, #2458 retains the old "naive" wave-speed estimate in elixirs.

issueDTO.title: ISLE: debugging feature to emit logging in the generated code
issueDTO.description:
To assist with debugging ISLE (e.g. you expect a rule to match but it doesn't), the `isle` crate should have an option to emit `log` macro invocations in the generated code.

I'm imagining we would emit the following logs, or something similar:

* `log::debug!(...)` at the start of a constructor, logging which constructor we are executing. (Ideally, we would also log the arguments given, but that would require that we know that the arguments implement `Debug`, which I don't think we do? Failing that, if we wanted to get real fancy, we could do the thing where you approximate specialization by making impls for `&T`, `&&T`, etc...)
 
* Each predicate we test as part of a term's rules' LHSes would have an associated `log::trace!(...)` that details which predicate is executing and then whether it matched or not.

* In each rule's RHS we would `log::debug!(...)` which rule we end up executing.

* Possibly, if none of a term's rules match, we log that fact as well. Not sure if we have erased this information by the time we emit code or not though, so it might not be possible.

To make this even more readable when debugging, it would be nice if we kept a thread-local or something containing the ISLE stack depth and indented our logs by that amount, so that you could see which constructor invocations were nested within others.

Anyways, once we had this knob in the ISLE compiler, we should add a cargo feature to `cranelift-codegen` which enables/disables it. (Or maybe we just reuse the existing `trace-log` feature?)
comments:
#### Subscribe to Label Action cc @cfallin, @fitzgen
This issue or pull request has been labeled: "isle" Thus the following users have been cc'd because of the following labels: * cfallin: isle * fitzgen: isle To subscribe or unsubscribe from this label, edit the .github/subscribe-to-label.json configuration file. [Learn more.](https://github.com/bytecodealliance/subscribe-to-label-action)

Thanks for writing this up! I agree we should do this; also it might be a good first issue (I'll add the tag). One particular thought on

> but that would require that we know that the arguments implement Debug, which I don't think we do?

I don't see a problem with adding this requirement if we don't have it yet; we control the main/only user of ISLE, the set of types that flow across the Rust/ISLE boundary are fairly small, are mostly little newtype wrappers, and even the big ones (`BoxCallInfo` as a `Box` of `CallInfo` returned from a helper) should be printable.
I can have a crack at this issue, will be going through the source code, any particular source file that is of interest, i would be happy to look into( I'm new to cranelift or compilers in general).

issueDTO.title: [clang-tidy] llvm-header-guard suggest invalid ifdef macros name
issueDTO.description:
When https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/llvm/header-guard.html check sees a file with has "llvm" inside its filepath (e.g. `clang-tools-extra/clang-tidy/llvm/HeaderGuardCheck.h`), instead of making such `ifdef`:
```cpp
#ifndef LLVM_CLANG_TOOLS_EXTRA_CLANG_TIDY_LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H
```
The check makes:
```cpp
#ifndef LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H
```

The check removes leading part if sees "LLVM" in check-name which is incorrect.
comments:
@llvm/issue-subscribers-clang-tidy

Author: Baranov Victor (vbvictor)

<details>
When https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/llvm/header-guard.html check sees a file with has "llvm" inside its filepath (e.g. `clang-tools-extra/clang-tidy/llvm/HeaderGuardCheck.h`), instead of making such `ifdef`:
```cpp
#ifndef LLVM_CLANG_TOOLS_EXTRA_CLANG_TIDY_LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H
```
The check makes:
```cpp
#ifndef LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H
```

The check removes leading part if sees "LLVM" in check-name which is incorrect.


</details>

Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: Baranov Victor (vbvictor)

<details>
When https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/llvm/header-guard.html check sees a file with has "llvm" inside its filepath (e.g. `clang-tools-extra/clang-tidy/llvm/HeaderGuardCheck.h`), instead of making such `ifdef`:
```cpp
#ifndef LLVM_CLANG_TOOLS_EXTRA_CLANG_TIDY_LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H
```
The check makes:
```cpp
#ifndef LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H
```

The check removes leading part if sees "LLVM" in check-name which is incorrect.


</details>
Hey @vbvictor, I would like to work on this issue.
I see why some folks decide to put a GUID in their header guards `:)`

> I see why some folks decide to put a GUID in their header guards `:)`

Just use `#pragma once` :)

> Just use `#pragma once` :)

It's what I use.  Unfortunately it's non-standard and has some surprises in filesystems with symbolic links and other irregularities.

> [@sathvikreddy853](https://github.com/sathvikreddy853) sure, but we have to think careful though. It seems to me that we should have one "llvm" name for `ifdef` if we are under "one after another llvm dirs" like this: [llvm/include/llvm/ADT/ArrayRef.h](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/blob/main/llvm/include/llvm/ADT/ArrayRef.h) (the result is arguably expected to be `LLVM_ADT_ARRAYREF_H`, not `LLVM_LLVM_ADT_ARRAYREF_H`).

@vbvictor Is the above problem specific to `llvm` directories that are one after another? Because I saw this header file `lld/include/lld/common/Arrays.h` with header guard as `LLD_ARRAYS_H`. Are there any rules for naming the header guards? Because in the above case `common/` is also removed from the header guard.


> When https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/llvm/header-guard.html check sees a file with has "llvm" inside its filepath (e.g. `clang-tools-extra/clang-tidy/llvm/HeaderGuardCheck.h`), instead of making such `ifdef`:
> 
> #ifndef LLVM_CLANG_TOOLS_EXTRA_CLANG_TIDY_LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H
> The check makes:
> 
> #ifndef LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H
> The check removes leading part if sees "LLVM" in check-name which is incorrect.

And this issue is because of this code
```
const size_t PosLLVM = Guard.rfind("llvm/");
  if (PosLLVM != StringRef::npos)
    Guard = Guard.substr(PosLLVM);
```
This code is considering the path that starts after the last `llvm/` in the absolute path.

repository.description: The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and toolchain technologies.
repository.name: llvm-project

summary.main: The check should make the correct `ifdef` based on the file path, not remove the leading part if it sees "LLVM" in check-name.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The check should make `#ifndef LLVM_CLANG_TOOLS_EXTRA_CLANG_TIDY_LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H` instead of `#ifndef LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H`.
summary.attemptedFixes: The check makes: `#ifndef LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H` instead of `#ifndef LLVM_CLANG_TOOLS_EXTRA_CLANG_TIDY_LLVM_HEADERGUARDCHECK_H`. The code is considering the path that starts after the last `llvm/` in the absolute path.
summary.otherNotes: This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. The check removes leading part if sees "LLVM" in check-name which is incorrect. The issue is because of the code considering the path that starts after the last `llvm/` in the absolute path.

issueDTO.title: kanidm_ldap_sync - password_import was unable to convert hash format
issueDTO.description:
I am currently trying to migrate a grown LDAP directory to KanIDM using synchronization.

After resolving the email problem, I am encountering another issue. We have been using a different hash algorithm.

The dry run was successful:
```
kanidm-ldap-sync -n
2025-11-06T11:08:07.372068Z  INFO kanidm_ldap_sync: dry-run complete
2025-11-06T11:08:07.372100Z  INFO kanidm_ldap_sync: Success!
```
However, when running the actual synchronization, I received an error:
```
kanidm-ldap-sync
2025-11-07T09:16:16.756935Z ERROR kanidm_ldap_sync: Failed to submit scim sync update - see the kanidmd server log for more details. e=Http(500, Some(Plugin(CredImport("password_import was unable to convert hash format"))), "HASH")
2025-11-07T09:16:16.758930Z ERROR kanidm_ldap_sync: Sync completed with error e=SyncUpdate
```
Is there a way to adjust the algorithm, or to force the user to set a new password and continue?
comments: I'd say an option to  "ignore invalid creds and alert the admin" would be a valid option in this case - the admin would have to manually start a cred reset flow and pass it to the user to complete, but that should be relatively easy to sort.

> I'd say an option to "ignore invalid creds and alert the admin" would be a valid option in this case - the admin would have to manually start a cred reset flow and pass it to the user to complete, but that should be relatively easy to sort.

I disagree, we should be telling the person that they have invalid data and blowing up. If we warned, people wouldn't read the warning and then users would silently get broken creds.

At least in this way, if invalid data is introduced then the admin gets an alert as monitoring of the sync status will show an error. If we did warnings, we are silently just dropping data on the floor. 

So IMO @ReimarBauer you need to solve your source data error to proceed.

> I'd say an option to "ignore invalid creds and alert the admin" would be a valid option in this case - the admin would have to manually start a cred reset flow and pass it to the user to complete, but that should be relatively easy to sort. To put it in meme terms :D

That's why I said it should be an explicit opt-in option not a warning 😉 

But having discussed this offline, there's problems with doing it.

Sync'd accounts can't set their credentials because it's locked until the migration is "finished" (because sync is designed for situations where a platform is progressively moving over)

This means any account with the invalid/unparse-able creds wouldn't be able to authenticate until the migration's "completed".

tl;dr probably best to reset the credential (because it's probably VERY old/insecurely stored) 😄

> tl;dr probably best to reset the credential (because it's probably VERY old/insecurely stored) 😄

Exactly. :)
@ReimarBauer for reference, the kanidmd server logs tell you what entry had the non-importable credential.

It's interesting that I'm learning about the quality of our historically grown LDAP during this migration. From the logs, I can see which types aren???t being migrated ??? right now I only ever see one type. So I don???t yet know if it???s the only type causing problems. In kanidmd, it's much easier for users to set a new password than it is with our current system. Thank you for that.

From a user workflow perspective, it would be simpler if they could check which passwords they are missing on the kanidm server (since they???ll be logging in there for the first time anyway) and set them there.

issueDTO.title: Config file: TOML to JSON5
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem?

TOML is a frustration format for having hierarchal data.

### Describe the solution / feature you'd like.

I would like it so we use .JSON5 instead of .TOML for our config files.  JSON5 (not JSON) is an upgraded version of JSON that supports both comments, and unstringed keys.

Example of json5:
```json5
{
  // comments
  unquoted: 'and you can quote me on that',
  singleQuotes: 'I can use "double quotes" here',
  lineBreaks: "Look, Mom! \
No \\n's!",
  hexadecimal: 0xdecaf,
  leadingDecimalPoint: .8675309, andTrailing: 8675309.,
  positiveSign: +1,
  trailingComma: 'in objects', andIn: ['arrays',],
  "backwardsCompatible": "with JSON",
}
```

### Alternatives you've considered.

n/a

### Additional Context

I used it in one of my projects and it was amazing for hierarchical data.

### I have confimed that...

- [x] ... such a feature does not exist already.
- [ ] ... I ticked all the boxes without reading them
- [x] ... such a feature request has not been submitted already.

issueDTO.title: Authentication error with MongoDB 8.1/8.2
issueDTO.description:
With newer MongoDB versions the authentication fails.

Reason is the following:
Any application that runs the buildInfo command before authenticating is incompatible with MongoDB 8.1.
([https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/rel ??? atibility/](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/release-notes/8.2-compatibility/))

mORMot calls buildinfo in TMongoClient.AfterOpen before TMongoClient.Auth because Auth needs the correct ServerBuildInfoNumber.

See discussion here:
https://synopse.info/forum/viewtopic.php?id=7418

issueDTO.title: Add webhook integration for Redmine, replace the plugin integration
issueDTO.description:
Zulip's [Redmine integration](https://github.com/zulip/zulip-redmine-plugin/) is currently a [plugin integration](https://zulip.com/api/non-webhook-integrations), we want to instead add a [webhook integration](https://zulip.com/api/incoming-webhooks-overview) replacing the plugin integration.

- Remove the existing Redmine plugin integration from the integration catalog; remove the "redmine" entry from `INTEGRATIONS` in [`zerver/lib/integrations.py`](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/main/zerver/lib/integrations.py#L610). Delete the [old template](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/tree/main/templates/zerver/integrations/redmine.md) to replace the existing [integration doc](https://zulip.com/integrations/doc/redmine) with the new webhook integration doc.
- Write a webhook integration for https://github.com/suer/redmine_webhook. Use the provided fixtures to design a suitable message template.

The new message template does not need to strictly correspond to the existing template, feel free to add support for any other relevant fields in the payload.

See https://zulip.com/api/incoming-webhooks-overview for details on how our integrations framework works.

It involves removing the existing Redmine plugin integration from the integration catalog, writing a webhook integration for https://github.com/suer/redmine_webhook, and designing a suitable message template. issueDTO.title: FR: redundant_field_names should distinguish between all and some fields matching
comments: Came here to upvote this FR. But I'd also add that the lint check should also ensure the style is consistent within a given initializer. I.e. if a field has a non-redundant value, then all fields should have explicit values given to them; and if all are redundant, then all should be removed. I think it'd be kind of awkward to have that be a separate lint check than this one, as otherwise the semantics of the two combined might get confusing.

summary.otherNotes: lint check should ensure style is consistent within a given initializer, redundant fields should be handled separately for all and some fields

issueDTO.title: Example_12: Fix ignored return value
issueDTO.description:
## Background
```
$ colcon build --packages-select ros2_control_demo_example_12
Starting >>> ros2_control_demo_example_12
--- stderr: ros2_control_demo_example_12                              
/workspaces/ros2_rolling_ws/src/ros2_control_demos/example_12/controllers/src/passthrough_controller.cpp:143:7: warning: ignoring return value of function declared with 'nodiscard' attribute [-Wunused-result]
  143 |       command_interfaces_[i].set_value(reference_interfaces_[i]);
      |       ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 warning generated.
---
Finished <<< ros2_control_demo_example_12 [7.47s]

Summary: 1 package finished [7.67s]
  1 package had stderr output: ros2_control_demo_example_12
```

There are different ways in fixing this, either explicitly ignoring it or use this information to give feedback:
https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Aros-controls%2Fros2_controllers%20set_value&type=code

## Instructions
Hi, this is a `good-first-issue` issue. This means we've worked to make it more legible to people who either **haven't contributed to our codebase before, or even folks who haven't contributed to open source before**.

We're interested in helping you take the first step, and can answer questions and help you out along the way. Note that we're especially interested in contributions from underrepresented groups!

We know that creating a pull request is the biggest barrier for new contributors. This issue is for you 💝

If you have contributed before, **consider leaving this PR for someone new**, and looking through our general [bug](https://github.com/ros-controls/ros2_control/labels/bug) issues. Thanks!

### 🤔 What you will need to know.

Nothing. This issue is meant to welcome you to Open Source :) We are happy to walk you through the process.

### 📋 Step by Step

- [ ] 🙋 **Claim this issue**: Comment below. If someone else has claimed it, ask if they've opened a pull request already and if they're stuck -- maybe you can help them solve a problem or move it along!

- [ ] 🗄??? **Create a local workspace** for making your changes and testing [following these instructions](https://docs.ros.org/en/rolling/Tutorials/Workspace/Creating-A-Workspace.html), for Step 3 use "Download Source Code" section with [these instructions](https://control.ros.org/master/doc/getting_started/getting_started.html#building-from-source).

- [ ] 🍴 **Fork the repository** using the handy button at the top of the repository page and **clone** it into `~/ws_ros2_control/src/ros-controls/ros2_control`, [here is a guide that you can follow](https://guides.github.com/activities/forking/) (You will have to remove or empty the existing `ros2_control` folder before cloning your own fork)

- [ ] **Checkout a new branch** using `git checkout -b <branch_name>`

- [ ] 🤖 **Apply `pre-commit`** auto formatting, by running `pip3 install pre-commit` and running `pre-commit install` in the ros2_control repo.

- [ ] 💾 **Commit and Push** your changes

- [ ] 🔀 **Start a Pull Request** to request to merge your code into `master`. There are two ways that you can start a pull request:
1. If you are not familiar with GitHub or how to create a pull request, [here is a guide you can follow](https://guides.github.com/activities/hello-world/) on how GitHub works.

- [ ] 🏁 **Done** Ask in comments for a review :)

### Is someone else already working on this?

🔗- We encourage contributors to link to the original issue in their pull request so all users can easily see if someone's already started on it.

👥- **If someone seems stuck, offer them some help!**

### 🤔??? Questions?

Don???t hesitate to ask questions or to get help if you feel like you are getting stuck. For example leave a comment below!
Furthermore, you find helpful resources here:
* [ROS2 Control Contribution Guide](https://control.ros.org/master/doc/contributing/contributing.html)
* [ROS2 Tutorials](https://docs.ros.org/en/rolling/Tutorials.html)
* [Robotics Stack Exchange](https://robotics.stackexchange.com)

**Good luck with your first issue!**

issueDTO.title: Refactoring for Unit Test Access Controls
issueDTO.description:
Part of #12048

## Issue
After most of the Unit Test migration in #12048, there are a lot of inconsistencies in access control test methods. This is because we did not migrate the many convenient, abstracted, and commonly used access control test methods from `ui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java` to `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`.

After merging #13254, all of the access control test methods in `BaseActionTest.java` have been migrated. Hence, this issue aims to refactor the unit test access controls to use these convenient test methods.

## Progress
The progress for this refactoring can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IcB-viJMrIOknYoBYasBuRBK9qnwY0-doEK4_Eb24IA/edit?gid=0#gid=0). I (the author) will update it when completed PRs are merged proactively.

## Steps to Contribute

1. Choose test(s) to work on in the above Google Sheets link
2. Check that no on else have claimed the test cases to work on within the last 2 weeks, or that it has been completed by follow up PRs (but not updated in the sheets)
3. Comment on this issue to indicate that you'd like to contribute on the chosen test(s). Update your comment if you need more than 2 weeks so that other contributors don't overlap with your work.
4. Create a PR to refactor the unit test(s).
5. Submit the PR, with a link to this issue by starting the description with "Part of #13304". 
6. Once all GitHub actions have all passed (or none related to your PR fails), tag me or any other active reviewers and wait for us to review (so that we can get a notification)

## Tips

- Understand the access control test methods in `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`, follow the refactoring in #13254
- Most of the access control testing logic in the migrated unit tests under `sqlui/webapi` follows the old unit tests under `ui/webapi`, so you may wish to reference the old unit test for help

#13359 by @zedonggg 

### Ready for/Under Review

#13400 by @MCcoc01

#13390 
#13398 
#13401

comments: This issue is now marked as stale after 90 days of inactivity, and will be closed soon. To keep it, mark it with the "no stale" label.
This issue is now marked as stale after 90 days of inactivity, and will be closed soon. To keep it, mark it with the "no stale" label.

I've just put together a draft PR (#9650) and I have some thoughts and questions about metadata validation.

While implementing the UI filtering for empty metadata fields (to match CLI behavior), I noticed that we're handling this validation on the client side in both the CLI and UI rather than in the API itself.

Currently:
- CLI filters empty key-value pairs before sending to API
- UI will now filter empty key-value pairs before sending to API
- API appears to accept metadata without validation

Should metadata validation be handled by the API instead?

Having validation logic duplicated across clients seems fragile. It means that any new clients or integrations in the future will need to implement the same filtering logic if we want to have consistency. It also means the API will silently accept this form of metadata if called directly. Also, I noticed that due to the lack of validation, you can provide duplicate keys, but since metadata is stored as a map/object, one value will silently overwrite the other. Users might not realize that they aren't storing the data they thought they were (e.g. what if it was a typo that caused the duplicate key?)

Some questions:
1. Are there intentional use cases for empty keys or values in metadata?
2. Should the API validate and reject invalid metadata (empty fields, duplicate keys)?
3. Are there other metadata validation rules we should consider (e.g., key format, reserved keys, value types, limits on number of entries or size of metadata payloads)?

Moving this validation to the API would ensure consistency across all clients and provide better error messages to users. I doubt this is high priority, but I wanted to raise the question since there might be backwards compatibility concerns or design reasons for the current approach.

> I've just put together a draft PR ([#9650](https://github.com/treeverse/lakeFS/pull/9650)) and I have some thoughts and questions about metadata validation.
> 
> While implementing the UI filtering for empty metadata fields (to match CLI behavior), I noticed that we're handling this validation on the client side in both the CLI and UI rather than in the API itself.
> 
> Currently:
> 
> * CLI filters empty key-value pairs before sending to API
> * UI will now filter empty key-value pairs before sending to API
> * API appears to accept metadata without validation
> 
> Should metadata validation be handled by the API instead?
> 
> Having validation logic duplicated across clients seems fragile. It means that any new clients or integrations in the future will need to implement the same filtering logic if we want to have consistency. It also means the API will silently accept this form of metadata if called directly. Also, I noticed that due to the lack of validation, you can provide duplicate keys, but since metadata is stored as a map/object, one value will silently overwrite the other. Users might not realize that they aren't storing the data they thought they were (e.g. what if it was a typo that caused the duplicate key?)
> 
> Some questions:
> 
> 1. Are there intentional use cases for empty keys or values in metadata?
> 2. Should the API validate and reject invalid metadata (empty fields, duplicate keys)?
> 3. Are there other metadata validation rules we should consider (e.g., key format, reserved keys, value types, limits on number of entries or size of metadata payloads)?
> 
> Moving this validation to the API would ensure consistency across all clients and provide better error messages to users. I doubt this is high priority, but I wanted to raise the question since there might be backwards compatibility concerns or design reasons for the current approach.

@zubron these are all excellent questions and it's a very good opportunity to bring @treeverse/product in the discussion.
IMO I believe there might be a use case for empty values, however we should definitely block empty keys.
Regarding where to put the validation - you made a good point regarding consistency over all clients when the server handles the validation however also consider the back and forth that could be spared if the validation is done on the client side.
Adding it on both client and server side might be a good mitigation. However if I had to choose only one I'd probably add it to the server side

This issue makes sense if user metadata in S3 does not allow empty keys. We need to check this first. Otherwise we break the S3 gateway. 

Assuming nonempty keys are on a par with S3, I agree >100% with both @zubron and @N-o-Z. This validation MUST occur on the server side. Otherwise you can create data via the API that the UI prevents. 
Afterwards, we CAN prevent this data on the UI - I imagine an invalid key could grey out the text in the box.
I agree with the above and wanted to add that it also not just non empty key. for example s3 do not allow the key to start with space and more.

issueDTO.title: Iterators: suggest `position()` instead of `enumerate() + find() + .0`
issueDTO.description:
<!--
Hi there! Whether you've come to make a suggestion for a new lint, an improvement to an existing lint or to report a bug or a false positive in Clippy, you've come to the right place.

If you want to report that Clippy does not compile, please be sure to be using the *latest version* of *Rust nightly*! Compiler plugins are highly unstable and will only work with a nightly Rust for now. If you are but still have a problem, please let us now!

Thank you for using Clippy!

Write your comment below this line: -->

This is sort of the opposite of #456. I recently wrote `let idx = v.iter().enumerate().find(|&(_, &ch)| ch == '|').unwrap().0`, when I should have written `let idx = v.iter().position(|&ch| ch == '|').unwrap()`. I'd have to think a little on the exact rule that should be followed here, but it would be nice if clippy could catch this pattern.

<!-- TRIAGEBOT_START -->

<!-- TRIAGEBOT_ASSIGN_START -->

<!-- TRIAGEBOT_ASSIGN_DATA_START$${"user":"GabrielBFern"}$$TRIAGEBOT_ASSIGN_DATA_END -->

<!-- TRIAGEBOT_ASSIGN_END -->
<!-- TRIAGEBOT_END -->
comments: This should be a simple addition to the iterator method chain lint
I'm taking a look at this - looks like an addition to methods.rs.

It seems that this issue has gone stale. I'd like to implement this if there is still interest. One question though: What about cases like `v.iter().enumerate().find(|&(_, &ch)| ch == '|').map(|x| x.0)` which is the same as `v.iter().position(|&(_, &ch)| ch == '|')`?
I'm filling to attempt to implement this and submit a PR if it is still relevant.
@rustbot  claim
