summary.otherNotes: The change should be backwards compatible to support user migration.

issueDTO.title: Add header ignore option to readability-duplicate-include
comments: Maybe it could check for an include guard and do not warn about includes which have none (as opt-in option).
Use `// NOLINT(readability-duplicate-include)` as shown here: https://godbolt.org/z/GYv3a6vqT
I was really hoping for a better solution than NOLINT considering how many instances of this exist in our codebase.  NOLINT seems like it should be used for the exception, not an established pattern.

As a point of comparision, `misc-header-include-cycle` provides an option to do a similar thing and as a more usable alternative to NOLINT.

> **IgnoredFilesList**
> 
>    Provides a way to exclude specific files/headers from the warnings raised by a check. This can be achieved by specifying a semicolon-separated list of regular expressions or filenames. This option can be used as an alternative to //NOLINT when using it is not possible. The default value of this option is an empty string, indicating that no files are ignored by default.
I believe this is a reasonable request and IMO not that hard to achieve given we already have similar option.

Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.
I would like to work on this one!

Hi, sure, just post a PR whenever ready.
Make sure to follow existing style of PRs in clang-tidy and follow along the existing style and structure in code.

> I believe this is a reasonable request and IMO not that hard to achieve given we already have similar option.

Yeah, no objection from me, really.  The original request seemed unaware of NOLINT as a solution.

Short of whitelisting all the files that are used this way, I don't see how you're going to avoid the false positives.  How can you detect this pattern reliably?  It would seem to require pretty sophisticated analysis of the included file.

> Short of whitelisting all the files that are used this way, I don't see how you're going to avoid the false positives

Me neither, but whitelisting I guess is the reasonable amount of tradeoff we can give in terms of "time spent working on the issue" vs "amount of benefit".

summary.main: Add a configuration option to the readability-duplicate-include checker that allows users to specify a list of headers that are OK to duplicate.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The checker should provide a configuration option taking a list of strings or regexes defining headers that are OK to duplicate, and also consider the option of checking for an include guard and not warning about includes which have none (as an opt-in option).
summary.attemptedFixes: The author suggests using a configuration option taking a list of strings or regexes defining headers that are OK to duplicate, and also mentions the possibility of checking for an include guard and not warning about includes which have none (as an opt-in option).
summary.otherNotes: This issue is considered a good first issue for contributors and provides a way to exclude specific files/headers from the warnings raised by a check. The author suggests using a configuration option taking a list of strings or regexes defining headers that are OK to duplicate. A similar option already exists in `misc-header-include-cycle`. The author also mentions that NOLINT can be used as an alternative, but it's not a preferred solution. The issue has been discussed and the author believes that whitelisting all files used in this way is a reasonable trade-off.

issueDTO.title: Tools config section missing on trunkrs.dev
issueDTO.description:
Trunk was launching an old version of Tailwind (3.3.5, I wanted 4.0.6), so I ended up diving into the source code and found a not-exactly-documented `[tools]` section. `[tools]` and `tailwindcss = "4.0.6"` does the trick, and there are a few more tools with version defaults as well as some other stuff.

It would be nice to add all of these to the official website's Config page.

Also, the most recent version of Tailwind seems to be a breaking change compared to 3.x and using the default settings while expecting 4.x causes errors. Updating it would be a breaking change too, but it might be worth it to clarify the current default version (as well as for the other tools) to avoid confusion & instruct how to specify the preferred version via the config.
comments:
If you want use tailwind-extra which provides daisyui.

```html
<html>
    <head>
        <link data-trunk rel="tailwind-css-extra" href="styles.css" />
    </head>
</html>
```

You can select the version v2.0.0 or higher, which provides daisyui 5.0 and tailwindcss 4.0.

The confusing is here you select in the tools tailwindcss with version you can find here https://github.com/dobicinaitis/tailwind-cli-extra

```toml
#Trunk.toml
[tools]
tailwindcss = "2.0.4"
```
let's address this after merging #987
hello, have you had the chance to advance on this ? thanks !

A documentation for the tools section would indeed be nice.

I had a similar issue using Bulma (a css library) which failed to build using the default version of dart-sass due to a sass breaking change. I found the solution by reading the code and finding the tools env vars (then realized that it could be use in the config file). And from what I saw (I didn't check)  it should also be usable as a CLI parameter (also undocumented) ?

🙏

issueDTO.title: TOpenApiParser-enhancement - "static"-Header-Parameters as a record instead of 1,2,3,4,... parameters for each method
issueDTO.description:
as discussed in [https://synopse.info/forum/viewtopic.php?pid=44358#p44358](https://synopse.info/forum/viewtopic.php?pid=44358#p44358)

- I have a schema that have 5 default-headers (they doesn??t change at runtime).
- in each endpoint I have to pass all 5 parameters (very bloated)

suggestion from Arnaud
> Perhaps the more elegant way to solve this may be to define a record with each used set of headers, then use it as a single mandatory parameter to the query?
> Then the client could prepare the values ahead of time, then pass it to each call, safe and sound.
> My guess is that there should be only a few types of records needed, since the headers are likely to be shared among URI.
> AFAICT in your schema they are almost always the same, but during the authentication/login phase when some "challenge" headers appear, and when retrieving the API feature set. So 3 or 4 records to use only.


Yes, that is a great idea! It would be supercompact and also very elegantly solved :-)

summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to a schema with 5 default headers that don't change at runtime, and the suggestion is to define a record with each used set of headers as a single mandatory parameter to the query.

issueDTO.title: Step request: Gear Lever (AppImage manager)
issueDTO.description:
I use Gear Lever ([Github](https://github.com/mijorus/gearlever)) to manage my AppImages. It's primarily used to easily add appimages to a central location and automatically create .desktop files, as well as other management operations. However, it also has a feature where either the AppImage's developer or the user can specify an update url (either a static url or a release from github, gitlab and other sites) for each AppImage and Gear Lever can update them. I think it'd be useful to be able to update AppImages along with everything else using topgrade.

The tool is flatpak only, so as far as I can tell it should work on any linux distribution that supports flatpaks. It also has a cli which can be used to update the managed AppImages from the command line, which topgrade could use. It's invoked as follows to upgrade all AppImages: `flatpak run it.mijorus.gearlever --update --all`. The command shows a yes/no confirmation prompt (oddly enough it does so even if there's nothing to update) which can be skipped using a `--yes` option. An AppImage name can also be provided instead of the `--all` option to update a single AppImage. It does not appear to have a `--dry-run` or similar option.

I've been using topgrade for a while and it is incredibly convenient, so thanks for all the work!
comments: Sounds simple enough, the only challenge is checking if it's installed, a simple `require` won't do. I don't use flatpak, is there a command to check whether it is installed?

Thanks for the quick response! Poking around, flatpak has an `info` command that errors if the package id provided is not installed and provides info if it is. For example:
- Installed package:
```
$ flatpak info it.mijorus.gearlever

Gear Lever - Manage AppImages

          ID: it.mijorus.gearlever
         Ref: app/it.mijorus.gearlever/x86_64/stable
        Arch: x86_64
      Branch: stable
     Version: 3.3.4
     License: GPL-3.0-or-later
      Origin: flathub
  Collection: org.flathub.Stable
Installation: system
   Installed: 21,2??MB
     Runtime: org.gnome.Platform/x86_64/47
         Sdk: org.gnome.Sdk/x86_64/47

      Commit: a88ca3469207cd1ee8dea91aefaee3ce2f6af9ff60d12879afc10d555c9b44c3
      Parent: d327a95165ec779c57ff142bc9decff41c381c07565126cb36c54c56ad82c505
     Subject: Merge pull request #117 from flathub/mijorus-patch-11 (d32e19d511d4)
        Date: 2025-07-04 09:24:18 +0000
```
- Package not installed:
```
$ flatpak info org.gnome.Extensions
error: org.gnome.Extensions/*unspecified*/*unspecified* not installed
```

There's also a `list` command that lists installed packages. Using `flatpak list --columns=applications:f` to list the full app id of installed applications you get an output such as:
```
$ flatpak list --columns=application:f

Application ID
app.zen_browser.zen
ca.andyholmes.Valent
com.belmoussaoui.Decoder
com.belmoussaoui.Obfuscate
com.dec05eba.gpu_screen_recorder
com.discordapp.Discord
com.github.Matoking.protontricks
com.github.PintaProject.Pinta
com.github.finefindus.eyedropper
com.github.jeromerobert.pdfarranger
com.github.rafostar.Clapper.Enhancers
com.github.tchx84.Flatseal
com.mattjakeman.ExtensionManager
com.spotify.Client
com.vysp3r.ProtonPlus
de.philippun1.Snoop
de.schmidhuberj.tubefeeder
info.febvre.Komikku
io.bassi.Amberol
io.ente.auth
io.freetubeapp.FreeTube
io.github.nozwock.Packet
io.github.realmazharhussain.GdmSettings
io.gitlab.adhami3310.Converter
it.mijorus.gearlever
```
Thx, let's add `require_flatpak` that checks the status code of `flatpak info <name>`.
FYI, Gear Lever is also [packaged](https://repology.org/project/gearlever/versions) in several different distros. The binary is `/usr/bin/gearlever`.
That means the flatpak stuff is only to be used as a fallback when `require("gearlever")` fails

issueDTO.title: URLs in tags like `website=*` are linked to Google Web Cache, which is counterintuitive
issueDTO.description:
When you go to [this issue](https://osmose.openstreetmap.fr/de/map/#item=5010&zoom=17&lat=49.8688359&lon=8.65837&issue_uuid=19ad6acb-3d39-de06-c5de-16c19c9fc681&loc=17/49.868836/8.65837&level=1) and click on the URL in the website tag, you go to a Google Web Cache search page instead of the displayed URL. This is both counterintuitive (misleading) and a naughty surprise for people who want to avoid Google because of privacy issues.

**Current situation**
> **website** = [https://www.aikidodarmstadt.de/](https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:https://www.aikidodarmstadt.de/)

**How it would be intuitive to me**
> **website** = https://www.aikidodarmstadt.de/ ([Google Cache](https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:https://www.aikidodarmstadt.de/))
comments:
I see we are not using the `prefered` tag2link config

https://github.com/osm-fr/osmose-frontend/blob/master/api/tool/tag2link_sources.json#L2498-L2521

Rank should be used here https://github.com/osm-fr/osmose-frontend/blob/master/api/tool/tag2link.py#L10

also, Google Cache (at least for me) simply does not work and returns 

> did not match any documents.
>
>Suggestions:
>
>    Make sure that all words are spelled correctly.
>    Try different keywords.
>    Try more general keywords.

for basically anything

The content of the tag2link config should be fixed up stream https://github.com/JOSM/tag2link

This issue is about a bug when Osmose use the tag2link file.

For your info: This GitHub issue is NOT fixed yet! URLs in `website=*` tags still lead to Google Web Cache! On this [issue detail page](https://osmose.openstreetmap.fr/de/issue/ce614583-e1ef-4b60-e942-f02a9e915508), you can find the following in the table at the bottom, in the list of tags:
??? ???
website https://www.kieferorthopaedie-darmstadt.de/praxis/ https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:https://www.kieferorthopaedie-darmstadt.de/praxis/

> For your info: This GitHub issue is NOT fixed yet! U

that is why it is still open, not closed

issueDTO.title: VR Office: Add CONTRIBUTING.md
issueDTO.description:
### Why
- Onboard first-time contributors.

### How (Implementation sketch)
- Include env setup, versions, build steps, PR process, Discord links.

### Definition of Done
- [ ] Code committed with minimal docs/tests.
- [ ] If client work: sample scene or prefab updated and runnable.
- [ ] Errors surface to logs/toasts; no silent failure.
- [ ] Meets privacy defaults (no content capture, aggregates only).

### Acceptance Criteria
- Fresh clone builds all in <30 minutes.

### Notes
- Each new Unity C# script or module ??? 200 LOC (except generated code); keep functions short & single-responsibility.

### Implementation Guidelines

**Code Quality Standards**:
- Each new script/module ???200 LOC (single responsibility principle)
- Use meaningful variable names (no single letters except loop counters)
- Add XML doc comments for public methods
- Follow project naming conventions (PascalCase for C#, camelCase for TS)

**Testing Requirements**:
- Unit tests for business logic
- Integration tests for API endpoints
- Manual testing checklist in PR
- Performance profiling if affecting critical path

**Documentation**:
- Update relevant README.md files
- Add inline code comments for complex logic
- Document any environment variables or config changes
- Update API documentation if adding/changing endpoints

**Dependencies**:
- Check Prerequisites section in main README
- Document any new package dependencies
- Verify compatibility with existing stack
- Update lock files (pnpm-lock.yaml, Packages/manifest.json)

**Review Checklist**:
- [ ] Code follows style guide
- [ ] Tests pass locally
- [ ] No console errors/warnings
- [ ] Performance acceptable (profile if unsure)
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] PR description explains changes clearly

**Common Patterns**:
See `/vr-office/docs/patterns/` for:
- Unity component patterns
- API service patterns  
- React component patterns
- Error handling patterns

issueDTO.title: Cleanup: allow runtime logs in unit tests
issueDTO.description:
# Enhancement

<!--
You MUST use this template when requesting an enhancement.
Provide as much info as possible so that we may assist in a timely manner.
Enclose all log/console output in triple-backticks.
Thanks!
-->

**Why is this needed?**:

While there are different philosophies for logging in unit tests, it can be helpful to see examples of runtime log output in unit tests. 

**Describe the solution you'd like in detail**:

For COSI's unit tests, the quickest and likely best way to implement this is using [testr.New](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/go-logr/logr@v1.4.3/testr#New) as suggested by @shanduur .

**Describe alternatives you've considered**:

Currently, no runtime logging is shown in unit tests, which is the other alternative.

**Additional context**:

Original discussion: https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/container-object-storage-interface/pull/170#discussion_r2504837590
comments:
Personally, I am in favor of this. We could discuss whether there are ways to optionally enable/disable this, but I would leave that for the future if someone asks for it.

Log outputs don't usually need strict unit testing, but it is important for developers to be able to get an idea of what logs will be shown during runtime so we can assess how debuggable system errors will be. For community-contributed PRs, being able to see the output logs in unit tests will mean we don't need to deploy COSI to see an example of runtime logs.

repository.description: Container Object Storage Interface (COSI) responsible for defining COSI spec and APIs, interfacing with COSI drivers, and managing the lifecycle of COSI objects.
repository.name: container-object-storage-interface

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to allow runtime logs in unit tests for COSI's unit tests, so developers can assess how debuggable system errors will be.
summary.validationOrRequirement: No specific validations or requirements mentioned.
summary.attemptedFixes: Currently, no runtime logging is shown in unit tests, which is the other alternative.
summary.otherNotes: The original discussion was in https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/container-object-storage-interface/pull/170#discussion_r2504837590. The author, BlaineEXE, is in favor of this enhancement and suggests using testr.New as a solution.

comments:
@yangdanny97 @grievejia 
shall i work on it????

Assigned, thanks!

I think this is the code pointer, when we `return x` we check the type of `x` against the return annotation, but when we just have `return` it looks like we skip the check and just assume None is OK

https://github.com/facebook/pyrefly/blob/ffd27c1e19f4e1a67ff06c6c6ba970df3932cd2b/pyrefly/lib/alt/solve.rs#L2924

Hey @grievejia @yangdanny97  I'm implementing the fix and ran into a question:
To report the error on the correct line, I need access to the

   `return` statement's `TextRange`.

The range is stored in `Key::ReturnExplicit(TextRange)`, but in `binding_to_type_info()` we only have access to `Binding::ReturnExplicit` (which doesn't have the range).

What's the best approach here:
 1. Add a `range` field to the `ReturnExplicit` struct?
 2. Pass `idx` through to `binding_to_type_info()`?
 3. Is there another pattern I should follow?

Thanks!
IMO (1) is preferred.

> IMO (1) is preferred.

Thanks 👍🏻

issueDTO.title: Deprecate `falcon.testing.redirected`
issueDTO.description:
Deprecate [`falcon.testing.redirected`](https://falcon.readthedocs.io/en/stable/api/testing.html#falcon.testing.redirected).

It is not too terribly useful, as, for instance, the popular [`pytest`](https://docs.pytest.org/) also captures and suppresses output from successful tests by default.

For use cases outside of `pytest`, we can recommend the stdlib's [`contextlib.redirect_stdout`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.redirect_stdout) and [`contextlib.redirect_stderr`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.redirect_stderr).

issueDTO.title: Information for new contributors
issueDTO.description:
Hi folks,

Welcome! If you are new contributor, here are some links to resources to get you started:

 - [Contributors documentation](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/development/contributing.html)
   - [Create a development environment for working on pandas](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/development/contributing_environment.html)
   - [Contributing to the documentation](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/development/contributing_documentation.html)
   - [Contributing to the codebase](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/development/contributing_codebase.html)
   - [Helping with issue triage](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/development/maintaining.html#issue-triage)

Please also consider joining our [contributors' community](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/development/community.html), where folks connect with each to resolve issues and discuss ongoing work.

If something isn't clear, or doesn't go smoothly, then you can ask in our contributors' community or [raise an issue](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/new/choose).

As we continue to evolve contributing to pandas, you can check back here for updates in the list below. Thank you for being a part of pandas!

Recent updates:
 - 2025.11.07: Gitpod, VSCode, and Docker development environment configurations [were removed](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/62859). These development environment setups were no longer maintained. You can refer to the configurations on the [2.3.x branch](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/tree/2.3.x) if you would still like to use these setups.
 - 2025.10.07: Commenting `take` on an issue will no longer add you as an assignee to the issue, and the project no longer meaningfully uses the "Assignees" field on an issue. If you are interested in working on an issue, you can leave a comment about your intention to work on it. If there has not been activity in the issue or an associated pull request in weeks, feel free to take over the issue. 
 - 2023.05.09: pandas is changing it's build system to meson. See the [new build instructions](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/dev/development/contributing_environment.html#step-3-build-and-install-pandas). If you run into issues, also checkout #49683.
 - 2023.02.24: The pytest arguments `--skip-slow`, `--skip-network`, and `--skip-db` have been removed (#51490). You can use `-m "not slow and not network and not db"` with pytest instead. See [Running the test suite](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/dev/development/contributing_codebase.html?highlight=slow#running-the-test-suite) for a full example.
 - 2022.10.24: We decided to remove the milestone ???contributors welcome??? across the entire project. That means that if you see an activity like _"@xyz removed this from the Contributions Welcome milestone X days ago"_ on issues tagged with _good first issue_, or any other label really, it's safe to ignore it. Please go ahead and contribute to any issue you are interested in.

issueDTO.title: Correct axe-core luminance number
issueDTO.description:
Axe-core uses `0.03928` for its luminance calculation. This number came from WCAG, however WCAG's number was wrong. This was corrected a while back to be `0.04045`. The change is theoretical, the difference is so small that the contrast ratio won't change. But it would be good to use update axe to use the same number that's in WCAG 2.2.

This change needs to happen in lib/commons/color/get-contrast.js
comments: #4933 I'd like to update the luminance calculation constant in lib/commons/color/get-contrast.js from 0.03928 to 0.04045 to align with the corrected WCAG 2.2 standard. While the practical impact on contrast ratios is negligible, this change ensures standards compliance. Can you assign this issue to me for the fix?

issueDTO.title: Section 6.6 of the Apache Beam Python programming guide lacks examples
issueDTO.description:
In the section "Using Schema Transforms" of the Python programming guide, which can be found [here](https://beam.apache.org/documentation/programming-guide/#using-schemas), there are missing examples. e.g.
##### *Nested fields*

Individual nested fields can be specified using the dot operator. For example, to select just the postal code from the shipping address one would write
##### *Wildcards*

The * operator can be specified at any nesting level to represent all fields at that level. For example, to select all shipping-address fields one would write

These paragraphs are eerily similar to the ones that can be found on the Java programming guide, but they have their corresponding examples.

Imported from Jira [BEAM-12825](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-12825). Original Jira may contain additional context.
Reported by: edusan.
comments: #23224 addresses the Select and GroupBy transforms, that are supported in Python. But there's still some inconsistencies in the "schema transforms" docs, e.g. it discusses DropFields, AddFields, etc.. that only exist in Java. We should also add languages switches for those sections. Leaving this open to track that.

issueDTO.title: Improve discoverability of the extension
issueDTO.description:
Problem: There are quite many OCaml extensions, some of which have more downloads than OCaml Platform and are higher in the search (see screenshot below). Users are not sure which extension to install, especially because @hackwaly's extension is installed 10x more and has official OCaml logo. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16353531/100584126-7d04f380-330d-11eb-89fd-10a90e41eec9.png)

2 things we can do about this:

1)  **Get recommended by vscode:** If a user opens a golang file, they are recommended to install golang extension (see screenshot below). If vscode allows such recommendations for language extensions developed outside microsoft, it would be nice to have this. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16353531/100583937-3a431b80-330d-11eb-8b3e-e801bb7c1ca2.png)

2) **Try contacting (again?)** other extensions' authors to add a pointer to the official OCaml vscode extension or deprecate as in case for Darrin Morrison's `OCaml and Reason IDE`, which is a great extension but is not maintained afaik.
comments:
>Try contacting (again?) other extensions' authors to add a pointer to the official OCaml vscode extension or deprecate as in case for Darrin Morrison's OCaml and Reason IDE, which is a great extension but is not maintained afaik.

I would like to accept your deprecation PR like [this](https://github.com/hackwaly/vscode-ocaml/pull/115). And you could change the logo if you want.
Thanks a lot @hackwaly! I'll send out a PR to do this 🙂
Just published new version to make new deprecation to take effect to vscode marketplace.

That's awesome 🎉 

Here's a screenshot of the extension explorer now:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6162008/100624755-0e7f6000-3324-11eb-9270-033a28269c1e.png)

I'll try to get in touch with the maintainers of "OCaml Formatter" and "OCaml and Reason IDE"  as well.

As for OCaml Debugger, we've been discussing about it and it would be interesting to explore an integration of `earlybird` in `vscode-ocaml-platform` Not sure what your plans are for it @hackwaly, but if it sounds like something you'd be onboard with, feel free to reach out (thibaut.mattio@gmail.com) 🙂

Right now `earlybird` is at alpha stage. But it goes on the right road. I hope someday it can be integrated into `vscode-ocaml-platform`. @tmattio 

Before that, `earlybird` need enter beta stage at least. Some issues have to be solved like these:

* Can't debug bytecode programs produced by ocaml compiler with version other than earlybird itself's.
* Some **must have** features, such as attach to running program.
* Some usability issues, such as accurate stepping. Maybe limited by ocamlrun.
* ...
@hackwaly Totally understandable, there's no rush for it. When you feel it's stable enough for an integration, we'll be happy to explore that with you 🙂

Hi! I am the author of [maelvalais.dune](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=maelvalais.dune). Would it 
make sense to remove it now that the extension `ocamllabs.ocaml-platform` supports `dune` syntax hightlighting?

**Update**: it is now [deprecated](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=maelvalais.dune-deprecated
)!

> Hi! I am the author of [maelvalais.dune](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=maelvalais.dune). Would it make sense to remove it now that the extension `ocamllabs.ocaml-platform` supports `dune` syntax hightlighting?

I think vscode-ocaml-platform supports everything your extension did, so it should be safe to deprecate or remove it. If you deprecate it, you could add a line that points users to this extension.
FYI: @darinmorrison

As I said in Slack, the Marketplace team will feature the extension on the official website in the second week of January of next year. It will help the extension to gain some views and downloads, and it will surface higher in the search results.

Sorry for the late response to this.

I have been planning to remove my old extension from the index listing. I will try to get to that soon.
@darinmorrison No need to apologize!

Now, the OCaml extension is featured on the homepage!
https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/vscode

> Now, the OCaml extension is featured on the homepage!
> https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/vscode

That's great, good job everyone!

For what it's worth, I think extensions like the one by @hackwaly still have value. It seems that the official extension adds a lot of features that might not be desired for some use cases. For example, in an educational setting, an instructor might want to lock down suggestion features and just have the syntax highlighting.

issueDTO.title: Remove Higher Order Components from Editors
issueDTO.description:
In `src/editors/`...

1. Replace `injectIntl` with `useIntl()` -> https://github.com/openedx/frontend-app-authoring/issues/2280
2. Replace usage of `connect` with `useSelector()` and `useDispatch()` -> https://github.com/openedx/frontend-app-authoring/issues/2312
3. Update the code and tests to get rid of the `Internal` export pattern:
Example of exporting `(Component)Internal` and `Component = injectIntl(connect(...))` HOCs, then testing with the `Internal` one.

https://github.com/openedx/frontend-app-authoring/blob/5df4cd941d176949a813146908dfcc3d6df2f915/src/editors/containers/ProblemEditor/components/EditProblemView/AnswerWidget/AnswerOption.jsx#L173-L174

https://github.com/openedx/frontend-app-authoring/blob/5df4cd941d176949a813146908dfcc3d6df2f915/src/editors/containers/ProblemEditor/components/EditProblemView/AnswerWidget/AnswerOption.test.jsx#L6

Once the HOCs (`injectIntl`, `connect`) are replaced with hooks, if it's necessary to mock redux state in tests, convert the tests to use `initializeMocks` from `src/testUtils.tsx` and pass in `initialState` to `initializeMocks`. Or use `const { reduxStore } = initializeMocks();` and dispatch changes to the redux store.
comments: Hi @bradenmacdonald quick question regarding `Replace usage of connect with useSelector() and useDispatch()` i heard that we are planning to move to react-query instead of redux in openedx, with that in mind, Do you think the effort to make `connect` replacement is worth it? or do you know if it will make easier the transition?

@diana-villalvazo-wgu It depends... Replacing `connect` with `useSelector` is quite an easy refactor, and could probably even be automated with a codemod, so it can be done very quickly and is a nice modernization that also simplifies the test suite. Whereas changing to react-query is a huge refactor that will be a lot of work. So for example, *if* your team has interest and availability to work on refactoring parts of the codebase to use React Query later this year, then I'd say it makes sense to skip this for now. But otherwise I think it'll still be useful to do, and also might (?) make the react-query change slightly easier later but I'm not sure.
Thanks Braden, Also fyi for `1.` Jacobo is working on it as part of this https://github.com/openedx/frontend-app-authoring/issues/2280 if you want to reference it here :)
Also i created https://github.com/openedx/frontend-app-authoring/issues/2312 and split it in multiple sub-issues to handle `2.`

repository.description: Front-end for the Open edX Studio experience, implemented in React and Paragon.
repository.name: frontend-app-authoring

summary.main: Remove Higher Order Components from Editors, specifically replacing `injectIntl` with `useIntl()` and `connect` with `useSelector()` and `useDispatch()`
summary.validationOrRequirement: Replace `injectIntl` with `useIntl()`; Replace usage of `connect` with `useSelector()` and `useDispatch()`; Update the code and tests to get rid of the `Internal` export pattern.
summary.attemptedFixes: Replacing `injectIntl` with `useIntl()` is already being worked on as part of issue #2280, and issue #2312 has been split into multiple sub-issues to handle the replacement of usage of `connect` with `useSelector()` and `useDispatch()`.
summary.otherNotes: The effort to replace `connect` with `useSelector` is considered a nice modernization that simplifies the test suite, but it might not be worth it if the team is planning to switch to React Query later this year.

issueDTO.title: [Feature]: Allow configuration of default LLM provider via Helm
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently, the default LLM (Large Language Model) provider can only be configured at runtime by the user. This limits control at the platform level and prevents administrators from setting a default provider through configuration management. It also complicates deployments where a specific provider is expected by default across environments.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Enable configuration of the default LLM provider in the Helm chart. This would allow platform administrators to define the provider via values.yaml or CLI overrides during Helm install/upgrade, making the choice consistent and manageable across deployments.

**Additional Context**
Additionally, the platform should support the ability to disable runtime configuration of LLMs, enforcing the use of the pre-configured provider and ensuring stricter platform governance where needed.

repository.description: Deploy and share agents with open infrastructure, free from vendor lock-in.
repository.name: agentstack

summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the description
summary.otherNotes: Currently, the default LLM provider can only be configured at runtime by the user, limiting control at the platform level and complicating deployments. The solution would allow platform administrators to define the provider via values.yaml or CLI overrides during Helm install/upgrade, making the choice consistent and manageable across deployments.

issueDTO.title: Squash pip freeze on startup [ENHANCEMENT]
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The Marqo startup process outputs a lot of text, and we want this to be cleaner. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Pip freeze should only be logged if log level is set to DEBUG or higher.

This can be done via an if statement in the run_marqo.sh script. 

Screenshots of Marqo's startup, before and after, at the default and at DEBUG log levels, attached to the PR would demonstrate that the feature works as expected. 

**Additional context**
- Documentation for configuring Marqo's log level can be found [here](https://docs.marqo.ai/0.0.21/Advanced-Usage/configuration/#configuring-log-level)
- Pip freeze and logging configuration logic is found in the [run_marqo.sh script](https://github.com/marqo-ai/marqo/blob/mainline/run_marqo.sh)
  - [Pip freeze call](https://github.com/marqo-ai/marqo/blob/mainline/run_marqo.sh#L10)
  - [Logging configuration logic](https://github.com/marqo-ai/marqo/blob/mainline/run_marqo.sh#L119)
  - [This](https://github.com/marqo-ai/marqo/blob/mainline/run_marqo.sh#L124) is the actual command used to start Marqo.

issueDTO.title: [X86] Make VBMI2 supported ISD::FSHL/FSHR instructions legal instead of custom
issueDTO.description:
FSHL/FSHR instructions are legal on VBMI2 targets for v32i16 / v16i32 / v8i64 types

FSHL/FSHR instructions are legal on VBMI2 + VLX targets for v8i16 / v16i16 / v4i32 / v8i32 / v2i64 / v4i64 types

There's no need to go through LowerFunnelShift for these cases, instead we should make them legal and add a combineFunnelShift to convert instructions with uniform constant shift amounts to use X86ISD::VSHLD/X86ISD::VSHRD.

We'll still need LowerFunnelShift to handle widening to 512-bits for VBMI2 only (no VLX) - but the constant handling can be moved entirely to the combine.
comments:
Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.


@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: Simon Pilgrim (RKSimon)

<details>

There's no need to go through LowerFunnelShift for these cases, instead we should make them legal and add a combineFunnelShift to convert instructions with uniform constant shift amounts to use X86ISD::VSHLD/X86ISD::VSHRD.

We'll still need LowerFunnelShift to handle widening to 512-bits for VBMI2 only (no VLX) - but the constant handling can be moved entirely to the combine.
</details>

@llvm/issue-subscribers-backend-x86

There's no need to go through LowerFunnelShift for these cases, instead we should make them legal and add a combineFunnelShift to convert instructions with uniform constant shift amounts to use X86ISD::VSHLD/X86ISD::VSHRD.

issueDTO.title: useConsistentCurlyBraces suggests invalid JSX
issueDTO.description:
### Environment information ```bash CLI: Version: 2.3.3 Color support: true Platform: CPU Architecture: aarch64 OS: macos Environment: BIOME_LOG_PATH: unset BIOME_LOG_PREFIX_NAME: unset BIOME_CONFIG_PATH: unset BIOME_THREADS: unset NO_COLOR: unset TERM: screen-256color JS_RUNTIME_VERSION: v22.20.0 JS_RUNTIME_NAME: node NODE_PACKAGE_MANAGER: unset Biome Configuration: Status: Loaded successfully Path: biome.json Formatter enabled: true Linter enabled: true Assist enabled: true VCS enabled: false Linter: JavaScript enabled: unset JSON enabled: unset CSS enabled: unset GraphQL enabled: unset Recommended: false Enabled rules: style/useConsistentCurlyBraces Workspace: Open Documents: 0 ``` ### Rule name lint/style/useConsistentCurlyBraces ### Playground link https://biomejs.dev/playground/?lintRules=useConsistentCurlyBraces&analyzerFixMode=safeAndUnsafeFixes&code=ZQB4AHAAbwByAHQAIABjAG8AbgBzAHQAIABDAG8AbQBwAG8AbgBlAG4AdAAgAD0AIAAoACkAIAA9AD4AIAAoAAoAIAAgADwAZABpAHYAPgAKACAAIAAgACAAewAiAHMAdABhAHIAdAAgAHsAewAiAH0ACgAgACAAIAAgADwAcwBwAGEAbgA%2BAFQARQBYAFQAPAAvAHMAcABhAG4APgAKACAAIAAgACAAewAiAH0AfQAgAGUAbgBkACIAfQAKACAAIAA8AC8AZABpAHYAPgAKACkAOwA%3D&ruleDomains.project=recommended ### Expected result As a result of `biome lint --write --unsafe` I get invalid JSX: I understand that it was "unsafe" but I did not expect to get invalid JSX as a result. I would expect Biome to keep characters that need escaping as JS expressions (in curly brackets): ```diff export const Comp = () => (
- {"start {{"} + start {"{{"} TEXT - {"}} end"} + {"}}"} end
); ``` Or do not highlight such strings as issues at all (to me it is still less destructive than the current behavior). ### Code of Conduct - [x] I agree to follow Biome's Code of Conduct
comments: @ematipico Updated the description as you asked

> I would expect Biome to keep characters that need escaping as JS expressions

I'd say "no change" is better, this would match Prettier (which, from what I understand, is Biome's formatting strategy)

There's little advantage in reducing the amount of string inside curly braces since you're still going to use curly braces; it just makes editing the text more involved.
I agree. Leaving it alone instead of minimizing it will just be easier to implement too.

repository.description: A toolchain for web projects, aimed to provide functionalities to maintain them. Biome offers formatter and linter, usable via CLI and LSP.
repository.name: biome

summary.main: The issue is about the useConsistentCurlyBraces lint rule suggesting invalid JSX as a result of running biome lint --write --unsafe
summary.validationOrRequirement: The lint rule style/useConsistentCurlyBraces suggests invalid JSX
summary.attemptedFixes: The author suggested that Biome should keep characters that need escaping as JS expressions (in curly brackets) or not highlight such strings as issues at all
summary.otherNotes: The expected result is meant to tell us how the output would be like if there wasn't a bug. No code fix? Different code fix? Etc.

issueDTO.title: Unify CLI command style between `spqr-router` and `spqr-coordinator`
issueDTO.description:
Currently, the `spqr-router` binary uses a run subcommand to start, while `spqr-coordinator` starts directly without it.
This inconsistency can be confusing for users switching between the two components.

Examples:

```
# Router requires 'run'
./spqr-router run -c examples/localrouter.yaml

# Coordinator starts without 'run'
./spqr-coordinator -c examples/coordinator.yaml

# Coordinator rejects 'run'
./spqr-coordinator run -c examples/coordinator.yaml
# -> Error: unknown command "run" for "spqr-coordinator"
```

**Expected behavior**:
Both binaries should follow the same CLI pattern ??? start with `run` command. The coordinator binary should support backward compatibility -- start without `run` as well.
comments: hey @Denchick I would like to work on this issue if its open for contribution.

repository.description: Stateless Postgres Query Router.
repository.name: spqr

summary.main: unify CLI command style between spqr-router and spqr-coordinator to provide consistent user experience
summary.validationOrRequirement: both binaries should follow the same CLI pattern, start with 'run' command, and coordinator binary should support backward compatibility
summary.attemptedFixes: none mentioned in the issue description or comments
summary.otherNotes: Inconsistency in CLI command style between spqr-router and spqr-coordinator can be confusing for users, examples provided

issueDTO.title: Enable continuous BenchmarkDotNet publishing in CI
issueDTO.description:
## Overview
Enable continuous and automated benchmarking for the repository using BenchmarkDotNet.

## Proposal
- Implement continuous benchmarking using the [`martincostello/benchmarkdotnet-results-publisher`](https://github.com/martincostello/benchmarkdotnet-results-publisher) GitHub Action as a reference.
- There is already a benchmarks project: `test/OpenFeature.Benchmarks`, which should be used for automated runs.
- Benchmark results may be published as a GitHub Page for visualization and tracking performance over time.
- The benchmarking workflow should be triggered daily and on every merge to the main branch.

## Goals
- Set up automated benchmark execution in CI/CD pipeline
- Publish benchmark results using the BenchmarkDotNet results publisher action
- Visualize results via GitHub Pages
- Ensure the workflow runs daily and on merges to main

## Reference
- GitHub Action: https://github.com/martincostello/benchmarkdotnet-results-publisher
- Benchmarks project: `test/OpenFeature.Benchmarks`
comments:
We tried some benchmarking before and the problem is that GH actions seem too susceptible to noisy neighbor and resource provisioning constraints.

I think we'd need self-hosted runners to get really good performance testing done.

> We tried some benchmarking before and the problem is that GH actions seem too susceptible to noisy neighbor and resource provisioning constraints.
> 
> I think we'd need self-hosted runners to get really good performance testing done.

@toddbaert: I want to start by having something set up and ready to run on GitHub runners. This will give us a clear baseline to work from. If possible, we can look at migrating to a self-hosted setup later on, but at least we???ll have an initial working solution in place from the start.

repository.description: .NET implementation of the OpenFeature SDK
repository.name: dotnet-sdk

summary.main: Enable continuous and automated benchmarking for the repository using BenchmarkDotNet, and set up automated benchmark execution in CI/CD pipeline.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Implement continuous benchmarking using the `martincostello/benchmarkdotnet-results-publisher` GitHub Action, set up automated benchmark execution in CI/CD pipeline, publish benchmark results using the BenchmarkDotNet results publisher action, visualize results via GitHub Pages, and ensure the workflow runs daily and on merges to main.
summary.attemptedFixes: Tried some benchmarking before, but GH actions were not suitable due to noisy neighbor and resource provisioning constraints.
summary.otherNotes: We tried some benchmarking before and the problem is that GH actions seem too susceptible to noisy neighbor and resource provisioning constraints. Self-hosted runners may be needed for good performance testing.

issueDTO.title: 💡 Prevent loading "super resolution" as the highest video quality
issueDTO.description:
<!--
(Click PREVIEW to undestand this template) 
               OPTIONALLY fill the table if each point fits in the same line: 
-->

??? _PROBLEM_: When setting the automatic video quality to 1080p or higher, older videos only available in 720p or lower will choose to use Youtube's new AI upscaling, which looks quite poor.  "Super resolution" appears underneath the selection in the quality drop-down to indicate this.
<!-- (Does your IDEA / feature request relate to a Problem? Which problem is? 
           Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] )-->

??? _SOLUTION_: Detect when a video's highest true resolution is 720p and restrict it as the highest bounds for being automatically chosen.

 ??? _RELEVANCE / SCOPE_: This feature would be entirely subjective, probably not a default.

SHORT Table | (Summary)     
------------ | -------------   
*Problem*     |  AI-upscaled video is unwanted.                                
*Solution*     |  Prevent it from being automatically applied.                                                          <!-- TYPE HERE, 1 line each) -->         
*Alternatives*|         
*Scope*         |    Subjective.       
*Side effects*|        
*Context*      |
comments:
Hi! 👋
I checked this issue and found the problem in the ImprovedTube.playerQuality() function
(js&css/web-accessible/www.youtube.com/player.js).

Right now, the extension tries to set 1080p even when the video only goes up to 720p. That causes YouTube???s ???Super Resolution??? AI upscaling, which is why it looks bad.

I made a small fix that checks the real available quality levels and limits it to 720p if 1080p isn???t available.

Could you please assign this issue to me so I can submit a pull request with the fix?

I've identified the fix in the ImprovedTube.playerQuality() function. The solution detects when a video's highest true resolution is 720p and restricts it as the maximum quality for automatic selection, preventing YouTube's AI upscaling from being applied. Can you assign this issue to me so I can submit a pull request with this implementation?

repository.description: Open YouTube & Video browser-extension [top~1] Enrich your experience&choice!🧰200+options; clever features📌set&forget📌Longest-standing. Join🧩us?👨???👩???👧???👧  ??? {playback|content discovery|player|extra buttons|distractions|related videos|shorts|ads|quality|codec|full tab|full screen}
repository.name: youtube

summary.main: Prevent loading 'super resolution' as the highest video quality by detecting the video's highest true resolution and restricting it to 720p for automatic selection.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The solution must detect when a video's highest true resolution is 720p and restrict it as the maximum quality for automatic selection.
summary.attemptedFixes: A small fix was made to check the real available quality levels and limit it to 720p if 1080p isn't available.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to a problem where older videos are upscaled using YouTube's AI, which looks poor. The solution involves detecting the video's highest true resolution and restricting it to 720p for automatic selection. The fix was identified in the ImprovedTube.playerQuality() function.

issueDTO.description: The copy to clipboard option in the settings tells me what it will do, but it won???t tell me what it will copy. This also goes for copying the names of authors. For example, if I want to copy the ???fediverse addres???, I will know that I???m copying something but not that I am copying the address. The same goes for some other input fields such as minimum count of tag display, display tag count for individual tags and some other input field that are not the classic typing ones. Mostly, comboboxes (dropdowns) and toggles. Those are not the only ones as there are still a few more places where this happens. For example, on the collections page when trying to follow a creator. There are probably more scenarios where this happens.

issueDTO.title: [BUG] Right click context menus appear as black boxes (non interactive)
issueDTO.description: ### Does an issue for this already exist? - [x] I have searched the existing issues - [x] I have ensured my environment (operating system, app launcher, etc) is up to date ### Operating System and Version Bazzite 42 ### Launcher Lutris (Recommended) ### Launcher Installation Flatpak (Recommended) ### Other Install _No response_ ### Wine Version ElementalWarrior (Recommended) ### Affinity Version 2.6.3 ### Desktop Environment KDE (6.4.5) ### Description The right click context menus are black boxes. No entries appear and they don't appear to be interactable with. I have tried clicking on areas but nothing happens so they do not appear to be invisible. Thank you for all the work on this project, it is amazingly helpful. I am happy to help gather additional information if anyone can tell me what you need. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Follow guides exactly. 2. Open Affinity Designer or Affinity Photo or Affinity Publisher 3. Create a new document. 4. Right click anywhere a black box will appear instead of the right-click context menu. ### Expected behaviour The right click context menus should appear populated. ### Screenshots ### Logs ```shell N/A ``` ### Config N/A ### Self-service - [ ] I'd be willing to fix this issue myself.
comments: Hey there Brokenshield, I was looking into this a bit and I am not super clear on how to recreate this issue. Have you tried to reinstall by any chance? I also would suggest the RUM guide as well as it has produced different results sometimes.

Hi, Just wanted to pop in and say I am having similar issues on a similar system:
- EndeavourOS 
- KDE Plasma 6.4.5 under Wayland
- Lutris
- NVIDIA RTX 3090

The issues only arise when using DXVK, when disabled, the context menus work fine however the canvas flickers a lot and makes the app pretty painful to use.

I have not yet tested on rum as suggested, going to take a peek at that shortly and will update.

Thank you so much!

So, I tried turning off DXVK (Vulcan is on) and Affinity Designer menus now
appear and it seems to all work perfectly. I'll try it with the others
(though Designer is my main tool for now)

- [ ] My own modified scripts

### Tasks

- [ ] An officially supported task in the `examples` folder (such as GLUE/SQuAD, ...)
- [ ] My own task or dataset (give details below)

### Reproduction

1. `pip install transformers`
2. `from transformers import AutoTokenizer; AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("mistralai/Voxtral-Mini-3B-2507")`

### Expected behavior

A clearer error message, suggesting to `pip install mistral-common`
comments:
I can reproduce, the fix should be fairly simple! 
Opening to the commuity!
@ArthurZucker I would like to work on this issue if it is still open
Here's the reproduced error..

https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/pull/41575
@ArthurZucker  please look into this PR  :)

**Fix:** Improved error handling in `get_spm_processor` to provide a clear and actionable message when the required SentencePiece model file is missing. **Before:** The tokenizer raised an unhelpful low-level error: **After:** It now raises a clear, descriptive error: ```python Missing SentencePiece model given file path: 'None'. This tokenizer requires a .model file provided by the 'mistral-common' package. Install it with: pip install mistral-common ``` This change makes the failure understandable and immediately actionable for users.

We now have 3 different PRs for this issue 😢 It's nice to see so much engagement, but please avoid opening too many PRs and coordinate on one PR instead if possible

Imo, #41592 looks the sanest to me as it goes a level above where it is supposed to be; will leave the decision to @ArthurZucker and @itazap tho. Also cc @jackzhxng to keep you in the loop

Thanks @vasqu for the recommendation :)
 Waiting approval from @ArthurZucker @itazap @jackzhxng

@ArthurZucker I'm looking in the code, and for Mistral there are no separate definitions of the tokenizer; they use Llama tokenizers from the llama, and in autotokenizer, they are also using it from the very same place. So, either I should create separate tokenizer definitions for Mistral, or is there something else we can do?
Hi, I'd like to work on this issue for Hacktoberfest!
@jackzhxng Hello Sir, i want to contribute on this project, so can i contribute??

Hi, Can you please review the changes I made to my PR #41592 based on @ArthurZucker suggestions.

@jackzhxng @itazap

#41592 Pushed a new commit that addresses edits by @vasqu .My Pr passes all checks and only one check is failing ( push_to_hub_* tests are failing with httpx.ReadTimeout and network-related issues (in test_image_processing_utils.py).

These seem unrelated to my changes in tokenization_auto.py.Could someone please re-run the CI when possible?
Everything else looks fine locally.Please take a look.
Checking comments to understand the issue better

repository.description: 🤗 Transformers: the model-definition framework for state-of-the-art machine learning models in text, vision, audio, and multimodal models, for both inference and training.
repository.name: transformers

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to provide a clear and actionable error message when the required SentencePiece model file is missing, and to make the failure understandable and immediately actionable for users.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The required SentencePiece model file is missing, and the tokenizer requires a .model file provided by the 'mistral-common' package. Install it with: pip install mistral-common.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix is to improve error handling in `get_spm_processor` to provide a clear and actionable message when the required SentencePiece model file is missing. There are also 3 different PRs for this issue.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the missing SentencePiece model file, and the fix is to provide a clear and actionable error message when the required file is missing. The fix is to improve error handling in `get_spm_processor`.

issueDTO.title: find good way of doctesting functions which output expressions
issueDTO.description:
What?
Have currently avoided doctesting functions which output expressions, as the str repr for expressions is quite abstract/does not seem useful to a user in a docstring. Would like to figure out a good way of dealing with this!

Why?
allow doctesting of these functions and improving  package readability

How?
Should brainstorm/read around solutions - though a possible one is to just call .with_columns using the expr and include this in the doctest as the final output
comments:
It looks like nw exprs now have much nice str reprs, so this should now be quite easy! 

outputs will just be the expressions, e.g. `nw.col('a').cast(nw.Float32)`

repository.description: Python package implementing transformers for pre processing steps for machine learning.
repository.name: tubular

summary.main: find a good way of doctesting functions which output expressions
summary.validationOrRequirement: improving package readability and allowing doctesting of these functions
summary.attemptedFixes: considered calling .with_columns using the expr and include this in the doctest as the final output
summary.otherNotes: avoided doctesting functions which output expressions due to abstract/does not seem useful to a user in a docstring

issueDTO.title: Fix Custom Layouts Build Section Instructions With Dependencies
issueDTO.description:
### Document issue type

Type/Bug (Report inaccuracies, outdated information, or missing details in the existing content)

### Description

Instructions to build the custom layouts [1] are incorrect and build fails due dependency failures. It is required to provide the exact steps including what are the dependencies required to build the identity-apps repository such as npm, node, etc.

[1] - https://is.docs.wso2.com/en/latest/guides/branding/add-custom-layouts/#step-3-add-a-custom-layout-design

### Version

IS 7.1.0
comments: I would like to work on this issue. can u assign this to me?
Hi @drsamitha, assigned you. Please let us know if you need to further clarify anything. Good luck!

Hi @pavinduLakshan . 
I got this two questions,

- Is there any temporary name that could include into the  `<UUID_OF_APP>` section in `carbon.super` directory for easily test the build?
- What is the minimum memory requirement for this build and any advice for low memory systems that can follow?

Sorry about the delay on this issue.

> Hi [@pavinduLakshan](https://github.com/pavinduLakshan) . I got this two questions,
> 
> * Is there any temporary name that could include into the  `<UUID_OF_APP>` section in `carbon.super` directory for easily test the build?
> * What is the minimum memory requirement for this build and any advice for low memory systems that can follow?
> 
> Sorry about the delay on this issue.

Hi @drsamitha, 

> Is there any temporary name that could include into the <UUID_OF_APP> section in carbon.super directory for easily test the build?

You can start the WSO2 Identity Server and register an application[1]. The UUID of that application can be used to test the custom layout.

> What is the minimum memory requirement for this build and any advice for low memory systems that can follow?

4GB RAM would be enough.

[1] https://is.docs.wso2.com/en/7.0.0/guides/applications/#register-an-application

Thank u for your promptly reply. After follow the documentation and tring to build the custom layout as exactly it explained, I ended up with this error and working on to fix that

_FIX: Seems like 4GB memory is not enough for the build since it raises running out of memory message and stop the build partially. So some dependencies (login-portal-layouts:jar:3.3.23-SNAPSHOT) will not build from `mvn clean install` command on `identity-apps-core` directory. Try adding more swap partition or just use git codespace. it just works. also [this](https://wso2.github.io/using-maven.html)_

Hi @pavinduLakshan , 

I made this [PR](https://github.com/wso2/docs-is/pull/5672) for this issue. Can u please review the progress and let me know if there any improvements that can do.

@drsamitha Your latest PR is currently under review. As we are about to begin voucher processing, could you please submit [this form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1tn3F1k3mERAXOCNNFOzX9i6rSSwbVcGkgkGL93Bgo5s/edit) for this issue?

Please note that submitting the form does not guarantee that you???ve earned the allocated points for this issue yet. However, providing your information at this stage will help us process your points promptly once your PRs are merged.

What if additionally include exact steps to customize layout at the end of [this section](https://is.docs.wso2.com/en/latest/guides/branding/add-custom-layouts/#step-3-add-a-custom-layout-design) as a script codes separately to windows and linux. 

For a sketch example,

```
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -e

if [ $# -ne 2 ]; then
    echo "Usage: $0 <IS_HOME_PATH> <IDENTITY_APPS_HOME_PATH>"
    exit 1
fi

IS_HOME="$1"
IDENTITY_APPS_HOME="$2"

WEBAPPS="$IS_HOME/repository/deployment/server/webapps"
AUTH_EP="$WEBAPPS/authenticationendpoint"
EXTENSIONS_DIR="$AUTH_EP/extensions/layouts/custom/carbon.super"
ASSETS_DIR="$EXTENSIONS_DIR/assets"

LAYOUT_SRC_DIR="$IDENTITY_APPS_HOME/identity-apps-core/components/login-portal-layouts/layouts"
LAYOUT_BUILD_DIR="$IDENTITY_APPS_HOME/identity-apps-core/components/login-portal-layouts"
LAYOUT_COMPILED_DST="$IDENTITY_APPS_HOME/identity-apps-core/apps/authentication-portal/src/main/webapp/extensions/layouts"
FINAL_DST="$AUTH_EP/extensions/layouts"

echo "==> Creating folder structure under Identity Server..."
mkdir -p "$ASSETS_DIR"

echo "==> Downloading layout files..."
curl -L -o "$EXTENSIONS_DIR/body.html" "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wso2/docs-is/master/en/identity-server/7.2.0/docs/assets/code-samples/body.html"
curl -L -o "$EXTENSIONS_DIR/styles.css" "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wso2/docs-is/master/en/identity-server/7.2.0/docs/assets/code-samples/style.css"
curl -L -o "$EXTENSIONS_DIR/script.js" "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wso2/docs-is/master/en/identity-server/7.2.0/docs/assets/code-samples/script.js"
curl -L -o "$ASSETS_DIR/illustration.svg" "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wso2/docs-is/master/en/identity-server/7.2.0/docs/assets/code-samples/illustration.svg"

echo "==> Copying custom layout to Identity Apps source tree..."
mkdir -p "$LAYOUT_SRC_DIR"
cp -r "$AUTH_EP/extensions/layouts/custom" "$LAYOUT_SRC_DIR/"

echo "==> Building Identity Apps (this may take a while)..."
cd "$LAYOUT_BUILD_DIR"
mvn clean install -q

echo "==> Copying compiled layout back to Identity Server..."
mkdir -p "$FINAL_DST"
cp -r "$LAYOUT_COMPILED_DST/custom" "$FINAL_DST/"

echo "==> All done!"
echo
echo "Your custom layout has been built and applied to the Identity Server."
echo "If the server was running, restart it before verifying the login page."
echo
echo "Custom layout directory: $FINAL_DST/custom"
```

issueDTO.title: Saving a video fails (and try to save a PDF)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0c72e32a-4ae2-4d05-8a91-b73e509b94e8)

comments: The context menu within the page is not context dependent - you get the same menu wherever you right-click on the page. Thus the "Save As..." applies to the entire page/document rather than the video under the cursor.

issueDTO.title: Can't edit S3 bucket settings after creating library
issueDTO.description: **Describe the bug** It's not possible to edit S3 storage service settings after creating library. This forces the user to delete and recreate library if any of the settings needs to be changed, for example spelling error in bucket name. Manyfold doesn't check if the bucket actually works before someone tries to upload files in it, so this might not be noticed immediately. **To Reproduce** Create library using S3 storage. Attempt to change any storage settings without deleting library. **Expected behavior** I'm able to edit S3 bucket settings after creating library. Specifically endpoint url, bucket name, region, access key ID and secret access key. Alternatively, Manyfold checks if S3 bucket is usable before saying library is ok and created. **Screenshots** **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - OS: macOS - Browser Arc
comments: Yeah, that's fair enough. I'll add it in.

repository.description: A self-hosted digital asset manager for 3d print files.
repository.name: manyfold

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to allow users to edit S3 bucket settings after creating a library, rather than having to delete and recreate the library if any settings need to be changed.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires the ability to edit S3 bucket settings after creating a library, specifically endpoint URL, bucket name, region, access key ID, and secret access key.
summary.attemptedFixes: No specific fixes mentioned in the issue description, but it might require checking if the S3 bucket is usable before creating a library and checking if the bucket settings can be edited after creating a library.
summary.otherNotes: The issue doesn't check if the S3 bucket actually works before creating a library, which might not be noticed immediately. Manyfold also doesn't check if the bucket is usable before saying the library is created.

issueDTO.title: Oauth2 generated accounts are not added as creators
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
On a selfhosted instance that only allows Oauth2 logins and users get the role contributor automatically, there are no premade creators for these users but when they try to create one with the same name Manyfold says the username is already taken.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Login as an Oauth2 created user
2. Try to upload model, but there is no creator of the same name
3. Try adding a creator of the same name
4. See error that the name is already taken.

**Expected behavior**
There should be automatically a creator for each account with the contributor role that gets auto-selected when uploading a model.

**Additional context**
Self hosted instance using official docker container setup.
comments: Good spot, thank you.

Only if I set the model completly public.

issueDTO.title: Speedup `test_car_interfaces`
issueDTO.description:
Takes ~1-2s per car. That's a big hit since we support nearly 300 different cars.

Goal is <=0.2s avg and <1s max on the CI machine, with the same test coverage. There's likely two or three things slowing this test down that'll be obvious with a bit of profiling.

Command to run:
```
pytest --durations=0 selfdrive/car/tests/test_car_interfaces.py 
```

comments: A good place to optimize is the hypothesis example generation. Speeds are ~2x faster than our current version in version 4.51.0 and get slower somewhere between then and 4.55.3. The latest version (6.102.6) is even slower compared to our current version (6.47). You can root cause and open a PR to hypothesis or openpilot depending on where the optimization lies.

Another option is to optimize get_fuzzy_car_interface_args by caching params_strategy to avoid regenerating strategies each time. Additionally, drawing st.dictionaries is quite slow; according to my tests, it can take up to 0.3 seconds.

> Another option is to optimize get_fuzzy_car_interface_args by caching params_strategy to avoid regenerating strategies each time.

I tried this and it didn't seem to work.

>  Additionally, drawing st.dictionaries is quite slow; according to my tests, it can take up to 0.3 seconds.

Right so it's likely a problem in the underlying library

issueDTO.title: Pinned tab causes resize loop on tab to its right
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

Pinned tab causes resize loop on tab to its right

### Description

If I have a pinned tab (1st tab), then the tab immediately to its right (2nd tab) would be stuck in a resize loop / endless flickering. Seems to only happen when the 2nd tab is less than the max tab width or something like that.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open first tab (e.g. `README.md`).
2. Pin first tab.
3. Open second tab (with a short filename, e.g. `.env`).

**Expected Behavior**: Second tab width is stable.
**Actual Behavior**: Second tab is stuck in a resize loop / constant flickering.


### Zed Version and System Specs

Zed: v0.209.7 (Zed) 
OS: Linux Wayland fedora-asahi-remix 42
Memory: 15.3 GiB
Architecture: aarch64
GPU: Apple M2 (G14G B0) || Honeykrisp || Mesa 25.2.4
comments: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c1602b5-2e24-4574-9ebb-7821d1464b70

Yeah that doesn't look good, thanks for the report!

This might actually be depending on your scale factor, as I just now was unable to reproduce this. But we recently had changes around GPUI that might be causing this. IIRC we also style something there conditionally, which is most likely the cause of this.

Optimistically labeling as "good first issue" because this should be good to track down and not too hard to fix, hopefully someone is able to both reproduce and look into this. Thanks!

I confirm this.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6b018aed-0a98-4d7f-bbc4-60268bfb9379
I can reproduce the bug, and will try to fix this as my first issue!

i belive this issue has been resolved as of zed stable release 0.211.4 although i didnt see any terminal tab related changes or pr's in the release notes(i might have missed) since i did encounter this previously but currently this is no longer the case

**Edit:** i observed this on **OS: Windows**

but i still dont know what caused the issue and what fixed it.

i have read the pr https://github.com/zed-industries/zed/pull/41884 but i dont think that fixed it since its still not merged
I also see that the issue is fixed. So this issue can be probably closed

I'm on 0.211.6 and it's not fixed for me. The reproducer in the OP still produces the same buggy behaviour.

UPDATE: Looks like it only happens with certain fonts, e.g.:

```json
{
  "ui_font_family": "Noto Sans Mono"
}
```

And as has previously been pointed out, this also only happens with fractional scale factor.
